callForPapers:
# Discovery Science 2025: Call for Papers

The **28th International Conference on Discovery Science (DS 2025)** will be held in **Ljubljana, Slovenia**, from **September 22-26, 2025**. This conference is part of the **AI for Science Conference**.

DS 2025 provides an open forum for intensive discussions and exchange of new ideas among researchers working in the area of Discovery Science, with a focus on the use of Artificial Intelligence methods in science. Its scope includes the development and analysis of methods for discovering scientific knowledge, drawing from machine learning, data mining, intelligent data analysis, and big data analytics, as well as their application in various scientific domains.

## Aims and Scope

The conference's relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Machine Learning (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised, self-supervised, active learning, online learning, transfer learning, continual learning, etc.)
*   Reinforcement learning
*   AutoML, Meta-Learning, Planning to Learn
*   Representation learning for vision, text, audio, language, and other data modalities
*   Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining
*   Anomaly and Outlier Detection
*   Learning from Complex Data, Data Streams, Evolving Data, Change Detection & Concept drift
*   Time-Series Analysis
*   Spatial, Temporal and Spatio-temporal Data Analysis
*   Unstructured Data Analysis (textual and web data)
*   Learning on graphs and other topologies
*   Complex Network Analysis
*   Causal Modeling and reasoning
*   Neuro-symbolic learning & hybrid AI systems (logic & formal reasoning, etc.)
*   Physics-informed machine learning
*   Computational equation discovery and Symbolic Regression
*   Data and Knowledge Visualization
*   Explainable AI and Interpretable Machine Learning
*   Human-Machine Interaction for Knowledge Discovery and Management
*   AI and High-performance Computing, Grid and Cloud Computing
*   Optimization
*   AI Creativity
*   Process Discovery and Analysis
*   Evaluation of Models and Predictions in Discovery Setting
*   Applications of the above techniques in scientific domains, such as Physical sciences, Life sciences, Environmental sciences, Natural and social sciences

### Special Sessions Themes:

*   Explainable AI for Science
*   Symbolic Regression for Science
*   Semantic Technologies for Science
*   Foundation Models for Science
*   Physics-informed Methods for Science

In addition to the main track, the conference will also host parallel one-day events focusing on specific applications of AI to different scientific disciplines. Please check ai4science.si for more details.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission starts:** April 1, 2025
*   **Abstract submission deadline:** May 24, 2025
*   **Full paper submission deadline:** May 31, 2025
*   **Deadline for review submission:** June 24, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** July 7, 2025
*   **Camera-ready version, author registration:** July 18, 2025

*All dates are specified as 23:59:59 SST (Standard Samoa Time / Anywhere on Earth).*

## Submission Procedure

*   Contributions must be written in English.
*   Formatting must follow the guidelines of the **Lecture Notes of Computer Science (LNCS) series by Springer-Verlag**. Templates are available.
*   DS 2025 uses **The Microsoft CMT service** for peer-review.
*   **Submission Link:** [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/DS2025/](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/DS2025/)

## Review Process

*   Submissions will be reviewed following a **single-blind procedure**. Authors should include their names and affiliations in the paper.
*   Dual submissions are not allowed: papers submitted should report original work and must not be under review or accepted for publication elsewhere.

## Proceedings

*   The conference proceedings will be published by **Springer in the Lecture Notes of Computer Science (LNCS)**.

## Page Limits

*   **Main conference:** Up to **15 pages** in LNCS format.
*   **Parallel one-day events (Workshops):** Up to **2 pages** in LNCS format (non-archival).

## Reproducible Research (RR)

Authors are encouraged to adhere to best practices of Reproducible Research by making available data and software tools. Submissions can be flagged as RR.

callForPapers:
# IEEE International Conference on Data Science and Advanced Analytics (DSAA) 2025: Call for Papers

The **12th IEEE International Conference on Data Science and Advanced Analytics (DSAA)** will be held in **Birmingham, UK**, on **October 9-13, 2025**.

## About DSAA

DSAA is recognized for its strong interdisciplinary synergy between statistics, computing, and intelligence sciences, and its cross-domain interactions between academia and business for data science and analytics. It is a dedicated flagship annual meeting in the field, widely recognized by Google Metrics and the China Computer Foundation.

DSAAâ€™2025 provides a premier forum that brings together researchers, industry and government practitioners, as well as developers and users of big data solutions for the exchange of the latest theoretical developments in Data Science and the best practices for a wide range of applications.

## Submission Invitation

DSAAâ€™2025 invites submissions of papers describing **innovative research** on all aspects of data science and advanced analytics. It also welcomes **application-oriented papers** that make significant, original, and reproducible contributions to improving the practice of data science and analytics in real-world scenarios.

## Conference Tracks

*   Research Track
*   Applications Track
*   Industry Track
*   Special Sessions
*   Tutorials
*   Journal and Special Track Papers

## General Enquiries

For general enquiries, please contact **academic.conferences@contacts.bham.ac.uk**.

## IEEE Code of Ethics

All participants are expected to adhere to the **IEEE Code of Ethics**.

callForPapers:
# DSN 2025: Call for Contributions

Welcome to **DSN 2025**, the 55th edition of the premier conference on **Dependable Systems and Networks**. The conference will be held in **Naples, Italy**, from **June 23-26, 2025**.

DSN 2025 aims to provide a rich program with numerous sessions, networking opportunities, and a chance to experience the vibrant culture of Naples.

## Contribution Tracks

We invite contributions across various tracks:

*   **Research Track**
*   **Industry Track**
*   **Workshops**
*   **Posters**
*   **Doctoral Forum**
*   **Artifacts**
*   **Tutorials**
*   **Disrupt**

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** **February 21, 2025**
*   **Notification Date:** **March 24, 2025**
*   **Registration Deadline:** **April 05, 2025**
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** **April 13, 2025**

*Please note that deadlines may differ for special tracks. Consult the respective track pages for specific details.*

## Awards and Grants

DSN 2025 will recognize outstanding contributions through several awards, including the Carter Award, Rising Star Award, Test of Time Award, Distinguished Artifact Award, and the Jean-Claude Laprie Award.

Travel grants are available for students, student volunteers, and young researchers.

## Committees

*   Organizing Committee
*   Steering Committee
*   Artifact Committee
*   Research Track PC
*   Industry Track PC

## Venue and Registration

Information regarding venue, accommodation, travel, visas, and registration can be found on the conference website. The registration portal is available starting February 13, 2025.

## Publication

Publications include accepted papers, artifacts, and potentially extended versions submitted to affiliated journals.

callForPapers:
# ACL 2025: Call for Papers

The 63rd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (ACL 2025) invites the submission of **long and short papers** featuring substantial, original, and unpublished research in all aspects of Computational Linguistics and Natural Language Processing.

ACL 2025 aims to have a broad technical program, encouraging submissions that contribute negative findings, survey an area, announce new resources, argue a position, report novel linguistic insights, or reproduce previous results.

## ACL 2025 Theme Track: Generalization of NLP Models

This year's theme focuses on **"Generalization of NLP Models"**, exploring how to enhance generalization across various dimensions, identify factors affecting it, evaluate capabilities, and understand limitations, particularly in Large Language Models (LLMs).

## Two-Stage Review: Submission to ARR, Commitment to ACL 2025

ACL 2025 utilizes **ACL Rolling Review (ARR)** for the initial review process. Authors submit articles to ARR, receive reviews and meta-reviews, and then commit their reviewed articles to ACL 2025 via the [conference commitment site](https://openreview.net/group?id=aclweb.org/ACL/2025/Conference).

*   The reviewing process is **double-blind**.
*   Authors are required to specify co-authors committing to reviewing during the ARR submission process.

## Submission Topics

Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Computational Social Science and Cultural Analytics
*   Dialogue and Interactive Systems
*   Discourse and Pragmatics
*   Efficient/Low-Resource Methods for NLP
*   Ethics, Bias, and Fairness
*   Generation
*   Human-Centered NLP
*   Information Extraction
*   Information Retrieval and Text Mining
*   Interpretability and Analysis of Models for NLP
*   Language Modeling
*   Linguistic theories, Cognitive Modeling and Psycholinguistics
*   Machine Learning for NLP
*   Machine Translation
*   Multilinguality and Language Diversity
*   Multimodality and Language Grounding to Vision, Robotics and Beyond
*   NLP Applications
*   Phonology, Morphology and Word Segmentation
*   Question Answering
*   Resources and Evaluation
*   Semantics: Lexical and Sentence-Level
*   Sentiment Analysis, Stylistic Analysis, and Argument Mining
*   Speech recognition, text-to-speech and spoken language understanding
*   Summarization
*   Syntax: Tagging, Chunking and Parsing

## Important Dates

All deadlines are at **11:59 PM UTC -12:00 (anywhere on earth)**.

*   **Submission deadline (all papers submitted to ARR):** February 15, 2025
*   **Author response period:** March 27 to April 3, 2025
*   **ARR reviews & meta-reviews available to authors:** April 15, 2025
*   **Commitment deadline for ACL 2025:** April 20, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** May 15, 2025
*   **Withdrawal deadline:** May 30, 2025
*   **Camera-ready papers due:** May 30, 2025
*   **Tutorials:** July 27, 2025
*   **Main Conference Dates:** July 28 - 30, 2025
*   **Workshops:** July 31 - August 1, 2025

## Paper Submission Details

*   Submissions should adhere to all [ARR submission requirements](https://aclrollingreview.org/cfp).
*   **Long Papers:** 8 pages (plus one additional page for final versions).
*   **Short Papers:** 4 pages (plus one additional page for final versions).
*   Follow instructions for [Two-Way Anonymized Review](https://aclrollingreview.org/cfp#instructions-for-two-way-anonymized-review).
*   Adhere to policies on Authorship, Citation and Comparison, Multiple Submission, Resubmission, Withdrawal, Ethics, and Limitations.
*   Paper submission templates are available.

## Presentation at the Conference

*   All accepted papers must be presented at the conference, with options for both in-person and virtual participation.
*   Papers must have at least one author registered by the early registration deadline.
*   Long and short papers will be assigned oral or poster presentations by the program committee.

## Contact

*   **General Chair:** Roberto Navigli
*   **Program Chairs:** Wanxiang Che, Joyce Nabende, Mohammad Taher Pilehvar, Ekaterina Shutova
*   **Paper Submission Inquiries:** [editors@aclrollingreview.org](mailto:editors@aclrollingreview.org)
*   **General Inquiries:** [acl2025pcs@gmail.com](mailto:acl2025pcs@gmail.com)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers - EATIS 2024

Dear colleagues, it is our pleasure to invite you to submit papers to the **12th Euro American Conference on Telematics and Information Systems - EATIS 2024** â€“ which will be held in **Cabo Verde** on **July 3rd-5th, 2024**.

EATIS.org is focused on the communities, contents and technologies belonging to **smart cities**. In particular, EATIS 2024 encourages the use of Information System (IS), Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) and Telematics Systems, making it easier for citizens to access government and public services at various levels, without any adverse impact on ethic aspects.

### Venue:
**University of Cabo Verde**

### Dates:
**July 3rd - 5th, 2024**

## Submission Guidelines

We kindly ask for submissions of high-quality **full papers** reporting original and novel research results on all above topics. All submitted papers will be **blinded and peer-reviewed**. Papers may be initially submitted in pdf (without author names).

### Paper Types and Length:
*   **Full papers:** max **8 pages**, presented in Oral Sessions.
*   **Short papers:** max **4 pages**, presented in Panel/Poster Sessions.

### Language Requirements:
*   Papers must be written in **English, Spanish or Portuguese**, unpublished and not submitted elsewhere.
*   Short papers will be presented in the Panel/Poster Sessions in English. Full papers will be presented in Oral Sessions.
*   Short and full papers will be presented **only in English**.
*   Papers written in Spanish or Portuguese must have an **English abstract, title, and keywords**.
*   It is highly recommended to include as a keyword, any of the 11 areas of interest to ease the reviewing process.

### Submission Platform and Template:
*   **Submission Link:** [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/EATIS2024](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/EATIS2024)
*   **Template:** [Template for submission](https://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template) (select the double column template)

### Download Call for Paper:
*   [Download Call for Paper](call.pdf)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: EASE 2025

The International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering (EASE) 2025, the 29th edition, is one of the premier conferences for research related to empirical software engineering. EASE welcomes high-quality submissions of technical research papers describing original and unpublished results.

## Tracks

EASE welcomes papers addressing topics related to evaluating and assessing software products, processes, practices, tools & techniques, including:

*   **Meta-science:** Papers about research methods and methodological issues.
*   **Infrastructure and techniques:** For conducting empirical studies on software engineering.
*   **Theory development, operationalization, testing, and application.**
*   **Applications in specific contexts**, such as:
    *   Software Requirements
    *   Software Architecture
    *   Data-Driven Software Engineering
    *   Global Software Engineering
    *   Software Design
    *   Software Construction
    *   Software Testing
    *   Software Operations
    *   DevOps and Continuous Delivery
    *   Software Maintenance
    *   Software Configuration Management
    *   Software Engineering Management
    *   Software Engineering Models and Methods
    *   Software Engineering Process (e.g., agile, hybrid)
    *   Software Quality
    *   AI-Based Software Development
    *   Human factors and behavioral aspects of Software Engineering
    *   Software development practices and process improvement
    *   Sustainability in Software Engineering
    *   Inter- or multi-disciplinary studies intersecting software engineering
    *   Artificial Intelligence for Software Engineering
    *   Ethics in Software Engineering

EASE also welcomes studies with negative findings or non-significant results.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** All papers must be submitted in PDF format.
*   **Submission System:** Papers must be submitted through the web-based submission system: [EasyChair for EASE 2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ease2025).
*   **Length:** Submissions must not exceed 10 pages for the main text, including all figures, tables, appendices, etc. Up to two additional pages containing ONLY references are permitted.
*   **Template:** All submissions should use the official [ACM Primary Article Template](https://www.acm.org/publications/authors/submissions). LaTeX users should use the following options:
    ```latex
    \documentclass[sigconf,review,anonymous]{acmart}
    \acmConference[EASE 2025]{The 29th International Conference on Evaluation and Assessment in Software Engineering}{17â€“20 June, 2025}{Istanbul, TÃ¼rkiye}
    ```
*   **Review Process:** EASE 2025 employs a **double-anonymous review process**. Authors must not include their names or affiliations in submissions. References to prior work should be in the third person, and any online supplements must also be anonymized.

## Review Criteria

Submissions will be evaluated based on:

*   **Soundness:** Rigorous application of appropriate research methods.
*   **Significance:** Impact on the field of software engineering.
*   **Novelty:** Originality with respect to the state-of-the-art.
*   **Verifiability and Transparency:** Sufficient information for replication.
*   **Presentation:** Quality of writing and adherence to formatting instructions.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Abstract Submission Deadline:** Fri 24 Jan 2025
*   **Submission Deadline:** Fri 31 Jan 2025
*   **Notification Deadline:** Fri 21 Mar 2025
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** Sun 27 Apr 2025
*   **Early Registration Deadline:** Sun 27 Apr 2025
*   **Early Registration Deadline for Authors:** Sun 27 Apr 2025

## Program Committee Co-Chairs

*   **Viktoria Stray:** University of Oslo / SINTEF, Norway
*   **Stefan Wagner:** Technical University of Munich, Germany

summary: The European Association for Machine Translation (EAMT) is an organization that serves the growing community of people interested in MT and translation tools, including users, developers, and researchers. callForPapers:
# EAMT Conferences

The European Association for Machine Translation (EAMT) hosts several conferences:

*   **The EAMT Annual Conference**
*   **The MT Summit Biannual Conference**

Further details regarding conference peer review policies can be found on the respective pages:

*   [EAMT Annual Conference Peer Review Policy](https://eamt.org/eamt-annual-conference-peer-review-policy/)
*   [MT Summit Peer Review Policy](https://eamt.org/mt-summit-biannual-conference/)

## Latest Conference News & Support

*   **MT Summit 2025:** Support is available for participants from low-income countries and war zones, as well as bursaries for translators and attendees with disabilities.
    *   [Support for participants from low-income countries and war zones](https://eamt.org/2025/03/17/mt-summit-2025-support-for-participants-from-low-income-countries-and-war-zones/)
    *   [Bursaries for Translators](https://eamt.org/2025/03/17/mt-summit-2025-bursaries-for-translators/)
    *   [Bursaries for attendees with disabilities](https://eamt.org/2025/03/17/mt-summit-2025-bursaries-for-attendees-with-disabilities/)

## Awards

*   **2024 Anthony C Clarke Award for the EAMT Best Thesis:** The awardee announcement has been made.
    *   [Announcement](https://eamt.org/2025/03/28/2024-anthony-c-clarke-award-for-the-eamt-best-thesis-awardee-announcement/)

## Other Information

*   **About the EAMT:** [Read more](https://eamt.org/about-the-eamt/)
*   **What is Machine Translation?:** [Learn more](https://eamt.org/what-is-machine-translation/)
*   **Membership:** Information on becoming a member and institutional/corporate members is available.
*   **MT Resources:** Includes an MT Archive and Software Compendium.
*   **Ethics:** Information on EAMT's ethical guidelines.

*Note: Specific details regarding submission deadlines, paper formats, and registration fees for upcoming conferences are not provided in the main website content.

summary: The European Chapter on Combinatorial Optimization (ECCO) annual conference, ECCO'2025, aims to bring together researchers in Combinatorial Optimization to present their work, share experiences, and discuss recent advances in theory and applications. A special issue of the Journal of Combinatorial Optimization will be devoted to work presented at the conference, with all articles refereed to high journal standards.
callForPapers:
# ECCO'2025: Call for Papers

The ECCO'2025 annual conference aims to bring together researchers in the field of Combinatorial Optimization to present their work, share experiences, and discuss recent advances in theory and applications.

## Primary Objectives:

*   Exchanging results and experiences in solving real-world combinatorial optimization problems.
*   Reporting on development and implementation of appropriate models and efficient solution methods for combinatorial optimization problems.
*   Establishing networking contacts between individuals and research groups working on related topics.
*   Promoting the work on combinatorial optimization (theory and applications) to the broader scientific community.
*   Identifying challenging research problems for the field, as well as promising research outlets (both in theory and applications).
*   Promoting interactions with researchers in other related fields.

## Publication

A special issue of the **Journal of Combinatorial Optimization** will be devoted to work presented at the conference. All articles will be refereed according to the high standards of the journal. Details of the process will be given during the conference.

## Important Dates:

*   **Abstract Extended Submission deadline:** March 15, 2025
*   **Notification of acceptance:** March 22, 2025

topics: Information Retrieval
summary: The 47th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR 2025) will be held in Lucca, Tuscany, Italy, from April 6 to April 10, 2025. ECIR is the premier European forum for presenting new research results in Information Retrieval, with a strong focus on postgraduate students and postdoctoral researchers.
callForPapers:
# ECIR 2025: Call for Full Papers

The 47th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR 2025) is the prime European forum for the presentation of original research in the field of Information Retrieval. ECIR 2025 will be held as a **physical (in-person) conference** from the **06th to the 10th of April 2025** in **Lucca, Italy**.

## Topics of Interest

ECIR 2025 invites the submission of high-quality and original papers in the broad field of Information Retrieval â€“ this primarily includes textual or textual with multimodal information. Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Search and ranking, including retrieval models and ranking, query and content analysis, web search, and theoretical aspects of Information Retrieval;
*   User aspects in IR, including information interaction, contextualisation, personalisation, simulation, characterisation, and behaviours;
*   System aspects, including retrieval and recommendation architectures, efficiency and scalability;
*   Conversational search and recommender systems, focusing on natural language understanding and generation, dialogue management, multimodal interaction, and user engagement in search processes;
*   Explainability methods, addressing the transparency, interpretability, and accountability of AI-driven systems, particularly for information retrieval, recommendation, and personalisation;
*   Machine Learning and Large Language Models for information retrieval and recommendation;
*   Applications, such as web search, recommender systems, web and social media apps, professional and domain-specific search, novel interfaces to search tools, intelligent search, and conversational agents;
*   Evaluation research, including new metrics and novel methods for the measurement and evaluation of retrieval and/or recommendation systems, users, and/or applications;
*   New social and technical challenges in IR, such as bias, ethics, fake news, and hate speech, IR-focused trustworthy & explainable AI methodologies and techniques.

## Full Paper Track

The Full Paper Track provides the opportunity for researchers to present their state-of-the-art research in Information Retrieval, which makes, or has the potential to make, a significant contribution to the field.

*   Full papers are up to **12 pages** in length plus additional pages for references. Appendices count toward the page limit. Please put appendices before the references for paper submission.
*   Full papers will be refereed through **double-blind peer review**, with an initial first-stage review followed by a second stage of discussion led by a meta-reviewer.

## Submission Guidelines

*   Authors should consult Springerâ€™s authorsâ€™ guidelines and use their proceedings templates, either for LaTeX or for Word (to be found at [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines)), for the preparation of their papers.
*   Springer encourages authors to include their ORCIDs in their papers ([https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/orcid](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/orcid)).
*   All submissions must be written in **English**.
*   All papers should be submitted electronically through the EasyChair submission system: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ecir2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ecir2025).
*   The corresponding author of each accepted paper must complete and sign a Consent-to-Publish form.
*   Accepted papers will be published in the conference proceedings in the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science series.
*   At least one author for each accepted contribution will be required to register and attend the conference to present the paper in person.

## Dual Submission Policy

Papers submitted to ECIR 2025 should be substantially different from papers that have been previously published, or accepted for publication, or that are under review at other venues. Exceptions are papers presented at conferences or workshops without proceedings, or papers previously made available as a technical report (e.g., on arXiv).

## Ethics and Professional Conduct

ECIR 2025 expects authors, PC members, and the organizing committee to adhere to accepted standards on ethics and professionalism, including ACMâ€™s Policy on Authorship, Code of Ethics and Professional Conduct, Conflict of Interest Policy, Policy on Plagiarism, Misrepresentation, and Falsification, and Policy Against Harassment.

## Key Dates (Full Paper Track)

*   **Full paper abstract submission:** October 9, 2024, 11:59pm (AoE)
*   **Full paper submission:** October 16, 2024, 11:59pm (AoE)
*   **Acceptance/Rejection Notifications for Full Papers:** December 16, 2024

## Other Calls

*   [Call for Short Papers](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-short-papers/)
*   [Call for Workshops](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-workshops/)
*   [Call for Demo Papers](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-demo-papers/)
*   [Call for Reproducibility Papers](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-reproducibility-papers/)
*   [Call for IR for Good Papers](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-ir-for-good-papers/)
*   [Call for Tutorials](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-tutorials/)
*   [Call for Doctoral Consortium Papers](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-doctoral-consortium-papers/)
*   [Call for Industry Day Presentations](https://ecir2025.eu/call-for-industry-day-presentations/)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ECMFA 2025

The 21st European Conference on Modelling Foundations and Applications (ECMFA) invites high-quality submissions of technical research papers describing original and unpublished results related to Model-Based Engineering (MBE).

## Aims and Scope

ECMFA is the premier European forum dedicated to advancing the state of knowledge and fostering the application of all aspects of MBE and related approaches. Its focus is on engaging key figures in research and industry to achieve stronger and more effective practical applications of MBE, leading to more reliable software based on state-of-the-art research results.

## Submission Types

*   **Foundation Papers:** These papers deal with modeling foundations, such as metamodeling, model transformations, model validation, verification and testing, model engineering methods and tools, and related aspects.
*   **Application Papers:** These papers deal with the application of modeling techniques, including experience reports on the use of MBE methods and tools, industrial case studies, or successful applications of MBE practices in industry or public administration with significant modeling lessons learned. All applications must have been done in real contexts, and at least one author must be from the company or administration where the application took place.

## Submission Process

*   Submissions must conform to the JOT LaTeX template ([https://www.jot.fm/templates/jot.zip](https://www.jot.fm/templates/jot.zip)).
*   Papers must not exceed **14 pages** (including figures, references, and appendices). Secondary studies may use 2 additional pages for references only.
*   Failure to conform to these guidelines may result in disqualification.
*   No simultaneous submission to other publication outlets is allowed.
*   All submissions will be peer-reviewed by at least three members of the Program Committee.
*   All papers must be submitted electronically in PDF format through Easychair ([https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=staf2025](https://easychair.org/my/conference?conf=staf2025)).

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Foundations of MBE (model transformations, domain-specific languages, verification and validation approaches, etc.)
*   Novel paradigms, formalisms, applications, approaches, frameworks, or processes for model-based engineering (e.g., low-code/no-code development, digital twins)
*   Interplay between MBE with and for AI-based systems
*   Application of MBE methods, tools, and techniques to specific domains (e.g., automotive, aerospace, cyber-physical systems, robotics, AI, IoT)
*   Successful use of MBE in connection with other disciplines (e.g., Artificial Intelligence, DevOps, Open Source, Safety Assurance)
*   Educational aspects of MBE
*   Tools and initiatives for the successful adoption of MBE in industry

## Review Criteria and Process

*   Papers will be assessed for novelty, significance, technical quality, rigor, and suitability.
*   Contributions can be submitted in two rounds.
*   Accepted papers will be published as platinum open-access journal publications in JOT.
*   Artifacts are recommended but not required for initial submission; they may be required for publication.

## Important Dates (AoE - UTC-12h)

*   **Round 1 - Abstract (Optional):** Fri, 17 Jan 2025
*   **Round 1 - Paper Submission:** Fri, 31 Jan 2025
*   **Round 1 - Author Notification:** Fri, 29 Nov 2024
*   **Round 1 - Submissions of Revision:** Sun, 9 Feb 2025
*   **Round 2 - Abstract (Optional):** Fri, 17 Jan 2025
*   **Round 2 - Paper Submission:** Fri, 31 Jan 2025
*   **Round 2 - Author Notification:** Sun, 23 Feb 2025
*   **Round 2 - Submission of Revisions:** Sun, 9 Feb 2025
*   **Final Notification to Authors:** Fri, 2 May 2025
*   **Camera Ready Version:** Mon, 12 May 2025

## Publication

All accepted papers will be published as platinum open-access journal publications in JOT. At least one author for each accepted paper must register before the early registration deadline and present the paper during the conference. Failure to do so will result in the paper being withdrawn from the proceedings.

## Contact

*   **Chairs Email:** [ecmfa2025@easychair.org](mailto:ecmfa2025@easychair.org)
*   **Questions:** Use the [ECMFA contact form](https://conf.researchr.org/contact2/staf-2025/ecmfa-2025-papers).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ECSCW 2025

We invite researchers and practitioners to submit contributions to the European Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work (ECSCW) 2025. The conference will take place in **Newcastle upon Tyne, UK, from June 30th to July 4th, 2025**.

ECSCW 2025 is a single-track conference that contributes to developing an interdisciplinary and global community, supported by EUSSET.

## Submission Types

*   Journal Papers
*   Conference Papers
*   Exploratory Papers
*   Posters & Demos
*   Panels
*   Masterclasses
*   Workshops
*   Doctoral Colloquium

## Conference Papers

Conference Papers offer an opportunity to publish concise and focused empirical or conceptual studies to support progress in a specific sub-domain of CSCW. This format is suitable for presenting pointed insights from fieldwork, compact arguments, or insightful experiences from designing, implementing, or sustaining collaboration systems.

### Focus Areas (Examples):

*   A new methodology for designing or examining CSCW technologies
*   Insights from the implementation of an IT system supporting collaboration
*   First experiences and insights from the use of a new system supporting collaboration
*   A case study of collaborative technology in a domain not typically studied in CSCW research
*   A discussion or unfolding of new CSCW theory

### Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission System:** All submissions should be made through the EasyChair submission page: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ecscw2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ecscw2025)
*   **Track Selection:** After logging in, select "Author submission" and then choose "Conference Papers" from the overview of tracks.
*   **Anonymization:** Submissions must be **ANONYMIZED**. Please ensure no author identification is present in the paper.
*   **Length:** While flexible, Conference Papers are expected to be no longer than **6,000 words** without references. Longer versions should be justified in the provided text field on EasyChair.
*   **Formatting:** All authors must use the provided Conference Papers template, available in:
    *   [Latex (Overleaf template)](https://ecscw.eusset.eu/2025/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ECSCW-2025-Submissions-Template.zip)
    *   [RTF](https://ecscw.eusset.eu/2025/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ECSCW-2025_Template.rtf)
    *   [MS Word](https://ecscw.eusset.eu/2025/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/ECSCW-2025_Template.doc)
    Submissions must be in **PDF format**.
*   **Review Process:** Conference Papers undergo a **double-blind, single-round peer review** by the EUSSET CSCW program committee. No shepherding or additional rounds of reviews are planned. Authors may be asked to review papers from other authors.

### Important Dates:

*   **System open for submissions:** January 15, 2025
*   **Submissions due for Conference Paper (extended deadline):** February 25, 2025 (23:59 AoE)
*   **Notification to the authors:** March 25, 2025
*   **Deadline for camera-ready version:** April 14, 2025
*   **ECSCW 2025 Conference Dates:** July 2 â€“ 4, 2025

### Contact Information:

For any queries regarding Conference Papers, please contact the ECSCW 2025 Conference Papers Chairs at: [ECSCW25_CP@easychair.org](mailto:ECSCW25_CP@easychair.org)

*   Erik GrÃ¶nvall (ITU, Denmark)
*   Gabriela Marcu (University of Michigan, USA)

## Publication

All accepted Conference Papers will be published in the European Society for Embedded Technologies (EUSSET) digital library (http://www.eusset.eu/digital-library) as an edited collection with an ISBN. Each paper will be assigned a DOI. The EUSSET digital library is an open-access repository, and authors retain copyright with options to grant EUSSET DL a non-exclusive license or use Creative Commons licenses (CC BY 4.0, CC BY-SA 4.0, CC BY-NC-SA 4.0) or dedicate the work to the public domain (CC0 1.0).

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: ED-MEDIA 2025

The World Conference on Educational Multimedia, Hypermedia and Telecommunications (ED-MEDIA) is an international conference organized by the Association for the Advancement of Computing in Education (AACE).

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** May 19-23, 2025
*   **Location:** Edinburgh, Scotland

## About the Conference

ED-MEDIA aims to advance Information Technology in Education and E-Learning research, development, learning, and its practical application. It serves as a forum for educators and researchers to share innovations and insights in educational technology.

## Topics

Topics of interest are available on the conference website at [https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/about/#topics](https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/about/#topics).

## Important Dates

*   **First Call for Proposals:** December 20, 2024
*   **Reviews Due:** January 6, 2025
*   **First Call Authors Notified:** January 6, 2025
*   **Final Call for Proposals:** April 11, 2025
*   **Early Registration & Author Confirmations:** May 7, 2025
*   **Proceedings Files & PPTs/Videos Due:** May 12, 2025
*   **Conference Dates:** May 19-23, 2025

## Submission Information

*   **Call for Proposals:** [https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/call/](https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/call/)
*   **Submission Guide:** [https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/submission/](https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/submission/)

## Presentation Types

Various presentation types are accepted, including:

*   Keynote & Invited Speakers
*   Best Papers by Country Sessions
*   Workshops
*   SIGs
*   Emerging Scholar Stream
*   Innovators Playground / Corporate Exhibits

## Publication

Proceedings will be published by AACE and archived in the Digital Library. Authors will be given a chance to update files during the conference for the final publication.

## Registration

Early registration is encouraged to save 30%.

## Contact

For more information, please visit the conference website: [https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/](https://aace.org/conf/edmedia/)

summary: The 19th European Conference on Software Architecture (ECSA 2025) will be held from September 15 to 19, 2025, in Limassol, Cyprus, at The St. Raphael Resort. This premier European conference provides a platform for researchers, practitioners, and educators to present and discuss recent findings and experiences in software architecture research and practice. ECSA 2025 is planned as an in-person event and will feature an industry track, tools and demonstrations, invited presentations, workshops, and a Doctoral Symposium.
callForPapers:
# Call for Research Papers

The European Conference on Software Architecture (ECSA) is the premier European software architecture conference, providing researchers, practitioners, and educators with a platform to present and discuss the most recent, innovative, and significant findings and experiences in the field of software architecture research and practice.

The 19th European Conference on Software Architecture (ECSA 2025) will be held from **September 15 to 19, 2025**. ECSA 2025 is planned as an in-person conference taking place in the beautiful city of **Limassol, Cyprus**.

## Theme: Impactful Software Architecture

The theme for ECSA 2025 is â€œimpactful software architectureâ€. We are interested in learning about software architecture principles and practices, emerging trends, and case studies highlighting strategic architectural choices that can lead to enhanced performance, improved collaboration, and long-term sustainability. The overarching question is how these architectural principles and practices, both well-established and emerging, are making an impact in real-world systems, and how that impact is being felt across various domains.

The Program Committee of ECSA 2025 seeks submissions of original and unpublished high-quality papers describing fundamental and applied research; new methods, approaches, and processes; novel applications; education and training in software architecture; and experience reports on all topics related to software architecture. We particularly encourage papers that demonstrate diversity in gender, culture, religion, country, etc., as key factors for success and innovation.

## Topics of Interest

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Foundational principles of software architecture
*   Relationship of requirements engineering and software architecture
*   Quality attributes and software architectures
*   Architecture practices for secure, explainable, and trustworthy software
*   Architecture design and analysis
*   Architecture description languages and meta-models
*   Architecture verification and validation
*   Management of architectural knowledge, decisions, and rationale
*   Architecture patterns, styles, and tactics; reference architectures
*   Architecture viewpoints and views
*   Architecture conformance
*   Software architecture virtualization and visualization
*   Architecture-centric process models and frameworks
*   Software architecture and agile, incremental, iterative, and continuous development
*   Component-based models and deployment; middleware
*   Software architecture and system architecture
*   Software tools and environments for architecture-centric software engineering
*   Ethics, cultural, economic, business, social, human, and managerial aspects of software architecture
*   Architecture and technical debt
*   Architecting for sustainable and environment friendly systems
*   Applying AI and LLMs in software architecture and architecting for AI and LLM intensive systems.
*   Software architecture education
*   Cross-disciplinary approaches to software architecture
*   Architectures for reconfigurable and self-adaptive systems
*   Architectural concerns of autonomic systems
*   Software architecture applied to new and emerging areas (e.g., cloud/edge, big data, blockchain, cyber-physical systems, IoT, autonomous systems, systems-of-systems, energy-aware software, quantum computing, AI-enabled systems)
*   Empirical studies, systematic literature reviews, and mapping studies in software architecture
*   Diversity, equity, and inclusion in activities related to software architecture

## Paper Submission Types

ECSA 2025 seeks four types of papers for the research track:

*   **Research papers:** (max. 16 pages in LNCS style) describing novel contributions to software architecture research (must have a sound scientific/technological basis and be validated).
*   **Education and training papers:** (max. 16 pages in LNCS style) addressing methodologies, experiences, and best practices for teaching and training software architecture.
*   **Experience reports:** (max. 16 pages in LNCS style) covering innovative implementations, novel applications, insightful performance results, and experiences in applying software architecture research advances to practical situations and systems.
*   **Short papers:** (max. 8 pages in LNCS style) presenting novel and preliminary work-in-progress or challenges. Submissions must have a sound basis, but not necessarily be fully validated.

## Review Process

All submitted papers will undergo a rigorous **double-blind peer review** process. Papers will be selected based on originality, quality, soundness, and relevance. Contributions must be original and not submitted elsewhere. Plagiarism checking will be conducted (more than 20% match will result in desk-rejection). Rejected full papers may be re-evaluated as short papers if the committee decides the work is preliminary.

## Open Science Policy

ECSA 2025 supports an Open Science policy, encouraging authors to disclose (anonymized and curated) data/artifacts to increase reproducibility. Sharing research artifacts is not mandatory for submission or acceptance.

*   Authors are required to include a **Data Availability statement** in their paper explaining artifact availability.
*   Authors are encouraged to share artifacts via the ECSA Zenodo community for eligibility for the best Open Artifact award.

## Formatting and Submission

*   All contributions must be formatted according to the **Springer LNCS style**. Page limits include figures and references.
*   Contributions must be submitted in PDF format via **EasyChair**: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ecsa2025](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=ecsa2025). Select the â€œResearch Trackâ€ for your submission.

## Publication

The proceedings will be published by **Springer** as part of the LNCS series. Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit an extended version of their research to a special issue of the **Journal of Systems and Software**.

## Important Dates (All times 23:59h AoE - Anywhere on Earth)

*   **Abstract Submission:** March 14, 2025
*   **Paper Submission:** March 21, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** May 9, 2025
*   **Camera-ready Paper:** June 23, 2025

## Program Co-Chairs

*   Nour Ali, Brunel University London, UK
*   Jacopo Soldani, University of Pisa, Pisa

callForPapers:
# ICCSA 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 International Conference on Computational Science and Its Applications (ICCSA 2025) will be held from **June 30 to July 3, 2025**, at **Galatasaray University, Istanbul, TÃ¼rkiye**.

ICCSA 2025 offers both **onsite and online participation options**, with virtual registration available at a reduced fee to accommodate researchers in challenging economic and political situations.

## Conference Scope and Goals

Computational science is central to most current research, industrial, and commercial activities, uniquely exploiting innovative ICT technologies. The ICCSA Conference offers an opportunity to bring together scientists from different disciplines, discuss new issues, tackle complex problems, and find advanced solutions that breed new trends in computational science.

## Review Process

Submitted papers will be subject to **stringent peer review** by at least three experts and carefully evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity of exposition. A **single blind review** method will be used, ensuring the publication of only top-quality contributions.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be included in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series. These proceedings are indexed by Scopus, EI Engineering Index, Thomson Reuters Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in ISI Web of Science), and several other indexing services. Papers will include linked references, XML versions, and citable DOI numbers. Authors of a selected number of top-quality papers will be invited to extend their papers for publication as special issues in highly recognized international journals.

## Warning: Fake ICCSA Conference

Be aware of organizations like WASET that run fake "conferences" by spoofing the names of real conferences. The Real ICCSA conference has been organised by the ICCSA Society since 2003. Please spread this news to your contacts and communities to avoid participation in fake conferences.

## Organized in Cooperation With

*   Galatasaray University, TÃ¼rkiye

## Sponsored By

*   The African Mathematical Union
*   Springer International Publishing
*   The University of Massachusetts, USA
*   University of Perugia, Italy
*   University of Basilicata, Italy
*   Monash University, Australia
*   Kyushu Sangyo University, Japan
*   University of Minho, Portugal
*   University of Cagliari, Italy

## Conference Themes (Tracks)

1.  **Track: Computational Methods, Algorithms and Scientific Application**
    *   Computational Biology
    *   Computational Combustion
    *   Computational Chemistry
    *   Computational Fluid Dynamics
    *   Computational Physics
    *   Computational Geometry
    *   Computational Mathematics
    *   Computational Mechanics

2.  **Track: High-Performance Computing and Networks**
    *   Parallel and Distributed Computing
    *   Cluster Computing
    *   Supercomputing
    *   Cloud Computing
    *   Autonomic Computing
    *   P2P Computing
    *   Mobile Computing
    *   Grid and Semantic Grid Computing
    *   Workflow Design and Practice
    *   Computer and Network Architecture
3.  **Track: Geometric Modelling, Graphics and Visualization**
    *   Scientific Visualization
    *   Computer Graphics
    *   Geometric Modelling
    *   Pattern Recognition
    *   Image Processing
    *   CAD/CAM
    *   Web3D, Virtual and Augmented Reality
4.  **Track: Advanced and Emerging Applications**
    *   Biochemistry
    *   Bioinformatics
    *   Astrophysics
    *   Biometric Modelling
    *   Environmental, Climate and Weather Modelling
    *   Geology and Geophysics
    *   Nuclear Physics
    *   Financial and Economic Modelling
    *   Computational Journalism
    *   Geographical Information Systems
5.  **Track: Information Systems and Technologies**
    *   Information Retrieval
    *   Scientific Databases
    *   Security Engineering
    *   Risk Analysis
    *   Reliability Engineering
    *   Software Engineering
    *   Data Mining
    *   Artificial Intelligence
    *   Machine Learning
    *   Learning Technologies
    *   Web-Based Computing
    *   Web 2.0
    *   Blockchain
6.  **Track: Urban and Regional Planning**
    *   Urban and regional growth
    *   Sustainable urban and regional development
    *   Socio-ecological systems
    *   Open Data, Big Data
    *   Cultural Heritage
    *   Smart and Sustainable Cities
    *   Mobility and Intelligent Transport Systems
    *   Decision Support Systems
    *   Complexity assessment and mapping
    *   Logistics

## Paper Submission Categories

*   **General Tracks and Workshops' Full Papers:**
    *   Length: **12 to 18 pages**.
    *   Format: According to LNCS rules. Visit [https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors](https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors) for templates.
*   **General Tracks and Workshops' Short Papers:**
    *   Length: **8 to 11 pages**.
    *   Format: According to LNCS rules.
    *   Content: Reporting preliminary results of ongoing research.
*   **PhD Showcase Papers:**
    *   Length: **10 to 18 pages**.
    *   Format: According to LNCS rules.
    *   Content: Reporting ongoing research with significant results, primarily by PhD students and junior researchers.

## Paper Submission Process

*   Submit via the official Submission site: [https://ess.iccsa.org](https://ess.iccsa.org)
*   Only papers submitted through the electronic system and strictly adhering to the relevant format will be considered.
*   When submitting to a Workshop, select the correct entry in the list box.
*   The work must be original, unpublished, and not submitted elsewhere.
*   At least one author of an accepted paper must register for the conference and deliver the talk.

## Important Dates

*   **October 7, 2024:** Start of Workshop proposal submission
*   **November 7, 2024:** Deadline for Workshop proposal submission
*   **November 8, 2024:** Start of Abstract and Paper Submission
*   **March 28, 2025:** Deadline for abstract and paper submission to the General Tracks (Workshops may have their own deadlines)
*   **April 15, 2025:** Deadline for reviewers
*   **April 20, 2025:** Notification of Acceptance
*   **May 8, 2025:** Submission deadline for the final version of the Proceeding Paper (hard deadline)
*   **May 8, 2025:** Registration and payment ends (hard deadline)
*   **June 30 - July 3, 2025:** ICCSA 2025 Conference

## Conference Policy

By submitting a paper, authors agree to the ICCSA conference paper submission, publication, and presentation policies. This includes confirming the work is original, has not appeared elsewhere, and will not be submitted concurrently to other venues. Upon acceptance, authors agree to transfer copyright to ICCSA, and one author must register and present the paper. No paper withdrawals are accepted after pre-registration or within three months of the event. Registration fees are non-refundable for changes or errors not attributable to ICCSA.

## Contact Information

    Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, University of Perugia

callForPapers:
# ICDS 2025: Call for Papers

The Nineteenth International Conference on Digital Society (ICDS 2025) will be held from **May 18, 2025 to May 22, 2025** in **Nice, France**.

### Onsite and Online Options

ICDS 2025 offers the option for either physical presence or virtual participation (pdf slides or pre-recorded videos) to accommodate various situations.

## Scope

ICDS 2025 continues a series of international events covering a large spectrum of topics related to advanced networking, applications, and systems technologies in a digital society. The conference aims to address the challenges of monitoring, controlling, and managing digital systems, ensuring user privacy and safety, and leveraging progress in cognitive science and knowledge management.

We solicit both academic, research, and industrial contributions, including technical papers, position papers, survey papers, short papers on work in progress, and panel proposals.

## Conference Tracks

*   **Trends in government-related actions**
*   **Trends in IT related governmental/public services**
*   **Digital society and robots**
*   **eGovernment services in the context of digital society**
*   **Digital accessibility**
*   **Citizen-centric disruptive and enabling technologies**
*   **Internet and Web services**
*   **eCommerce and eBusiness**
*   **Citizen-oriented digital evidence**
*   **Consumer-oriented devices and services**
*   **Intelligent computation**
*   **Networking and telecommunications**
*   **eDefense for security and protection**
*   **Intrusion Prevention and Detection Systems**
*   **Enforced citizen-centric paradigms**
*   **Web accessibility**
*   **Computational advertising**
*   **Management and control**
*   **Digital analysis and processing**
*   **Mobile devices and biotechnologies**
*   **Software and system robustness for digital society**
*   **Consumer-oriented digital design**
*   **Social networking**
*   **ICT support and applications for eCollaboration**
*   **Cyberlaws**

## Contribution Types

*   **Regular Papers:** (up to 6-10 pages; 6 pages covered by regular registration; max 4 extra pages allowed at additional cost) (oral presentation)
*   **Short papers (work in progress):** (up to 4 pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Ideas contributions:** (2 pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Extended abstracts:** (2 pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Posters (paper-based):** (two pages long) (oral presentation)
*   **Posters (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation)
*   **Presentations (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation)
*   **Demos:** (two pages) [posted on www.iaria.org]
*   **Tutorial proposals**
*   **Panel proposals**

## Important Dates

*   **Submission:** Feb 21, 2025
*   **Notification:** Mar 24, 2025
*   **Registration:** Apr 05, 2025
*   **Camera ready:** Apr 13, 2025

Deadlines differ for special tracks. Please consult the conference home page for special tracks Call for Papers (if any).

## Publication

*   Published by IARIA Press (operated by Xpert Publishing Services)
*   Archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library
*   Prints available at Curran Associates, Inc.
*   Authors of selected papers will be invited to submit extended versions to a IARIA Journal.

## Submission Guidelines and Formats

*   Only .pdf or .doc files will be accepted for paper submission.
*   Final author manuscripts will be 8.5" x 11", not exceeding 6 pages; max 4 extra pages allowed at additional cost.
*   **MS Word Template:** Information can be found [here](https://www.iaria.org/conferences/index.html).
*   **LaTeX Template:** A community-provided LaTeX template is available via the CTAN package iaria. A minimal working example is also available as an Overleaf template.
*   Slides-based contributions can use the corporate/university format and style.
*   Your paper should also comply with the additional editorial rules.

## Instructions for Authors

*   At least one author of each accepted paper must register to ensure that the paper will be included in the conference proceedings and in the digital library, or posted on www.iaria.org (for slide-based contributions).
*   We recommend not using too many extra pages, even if affordable. No more than 2 contributions per event are recommended, as each must be separately registered and paid for.

## Steering Committee

*   Lasse Berntzen, University of South-Eastern Norway, Norway
*   Claus-Peter RÃ¼ckemann, UniversitÃ¤t MÃ¼nster / DIMF / Leibniz UniversitÃ¤t Hannover, Germany
*   Theo Lynn, Irish Institute of Digital Business, Dublin City University, Ireland
*   Olga Levina, Technische Hochschule Brandenburg, Germany
*   Claudia HeÃŸ, IU Internationale Hochschule, Germany

callForPapers:
# Call for Research Papers - ICDE 2025

The annual IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) is one of the premier conferences in data and information engineering. ICDE 2025 will take place in **Hong Kong SAR, China**, from **May 19 â€“ 23, 2025**.

## Topics of Interest

We invite the submission of original research contributions in the following areas as they relate to data management:

*   AI for Database Systems and Database Systems for AI
*   Benchmarking, Performance Modeling, Tuning, and Testing
*   Cloud Data Management
*   Crowdsourcing and Data Management
*   Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Data Models, Semantics, Query languages
*   Data Stream Systems and Edge Computing
*   Very Large Data Visualization and Interactive Data Exploration
*   Database Security and Privacy
*   Distributed Ledgers and Blockchains
*   Distributed, Parallel and P2P Data Management
*   Explainability, Fairness, and Trust in Data Systems and Analysis
*   Graphs, Networks, and Semi-structured Data Management
*   Information Integration and Data Quality
*   IoT Data Management
*   Modern Hardware and In-Memory Database Systems
*   Query Processing, Indexing, and Optimization
*   Transaction Management
*   Spatial Databases and Temporal Databases
*   Text, Semi-Structured Data Management, Multimedia Databases
*   Information Retrieval from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Uncertain, Probabilistic, and Approximate Databases
*   Very Large Data Science Applications/Pipelines
*   Workflows, Scientific Data Management

We also welcome any original contributions that may cross the boundaries among areas or point in other novel directions of interest to the database research community.

## Important Dates

ICDE 2025 will have two rounds of research paper submissions with each round involving two reviewing phases.

*All deadlines are **11:59PM AoE**.*

### First Round:

*   Submission due: **August 2, 2024**
*   Notification for authors (Accept/Revise/Reject): **September 24, 2024**
*   Revision due: **October 29, 2024**
*   Notification to authors (Accept/Reject): **November 26, 2024**
*   Camera-ready copy due: **December 10, 2024**

### Second Round:

*   Submission due: **November 25, 2024**
*   Notification for Authors (Accept/Revise/Reject): **January 21, 2025**
*   Revision Due: **February 25, 2025**
*   Notification to authors (Accept/Reject): **March 25, 2025**
*   Camera-ready copy due: **April 8, 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Tool:** Submit papers using the Conference Management Tool at `https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025`.
*   **Format:** Manuscripts must be prepared in accordance with the IEEE format available at `https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html`.
*   **Length:** Research papers must not exceed **12 pages** not including the references. No appendix is allowed.
*   **File Type:** Only electronic submissions in **PDF format** will be considered.
*   **Originality:** A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 cannot be under review for any other conference or journal during the entire time it is considered for ICDE 2025, and it must be substantially different from any previously published work. Submissions must cite prior publications and relevant work.
*   **Author Limit:** Any author of ICDE 2025 should not be a co-author of more than **10 submitted research papers** across the two submission rounds.
*   **Reviewing:** Submissions will be reviewed in a **single-blind manner**.
*   **Revisions:** Papers may be invited to submit a revised version if the PC believes they can be reasonably improved within the allocated revision time frame (five weeks).
*   **Best Papers:** The best papers will be selected for submission as an extended version to the IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE).
*   **No-show Policy:** IEEE reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution (e.g., remove it from IEEE Xplore) after the conference if none of the authors attend the conference to present their paper.

## Desk Rejection Policy

ICDE research track submissions that do not meet the following requirements may be rejected without review:

*   Adherence to guidelines, length, and format requirements.
*   Alignment with ICDE 2025 scope (data management, scalability, efficiency aspects).
*   Correct declaration of all conflicts of interest (COI) with members of the program committee. Both not reporting COIs as well as frivolously defining COIs count as a violation.
*   Proper COI declaration in the CMT system is mandatory for all authors.

## Conflict of Interest (COI)

An author X of an ICDE 2025 research paper has a COI with a PC member or Area Chair Y if one or more of the following conditions hold:

*   X is a co-author of another ICDE 2025 submission together with Y.
*   X has been a co-author of Y in a publication in the past three years.
*   X has been a co-author of Y for 4 (or more) publications in the last 10 years.
*   X has been a co-worker of Y in the same company or university within the past three years.
*   X has been a collaborator of Y within the past three years (e.g., held a joint grant).
*   X is or was Yâ€™s primary thesis advisor or vice versa.
*   X is a relative or a close personal friend of Y.

The onus for correctly declaring COIs rests with the authors. Papers with incorrect or incomplete COI information are subject to immediate rejection.

## Reviewing Process

Papers will be stringently reviewed with at least 3 reviews per paper, coordinated by a meta-reviewer. Revisions will go through an additional round of reviews before a final decision.

## Inclusions and Diversity in Writing

Authors are encouraged to use mindful language and examples that promote diversity and inclusion, and avoid language or examples that further marginalization, stereotyping, or erasure of any group.

callForPapers:
# Call for Research Papers - IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) 2025

The annual IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) is one of the premier conferences in data and information engineering, addressing research issues on designing, building, managing, and evaluating advanced data intensive systems and applications. ICDE 2025 serves as a leading forum for researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and exchange techniques, tools, and experiences.

ICDE 2025 will take place in **Hong Kong SAR, China**, from **May 19 â€“ 23, 2025**.

## Topics of Interest

We invite the submission of original research contributions in the following areas as they relate to data management:

*   AI for Database Systems and Database Systems for AI
*   Benchmarking, Performance Modeling, Tuning, and Testing
*   Cloud Data Management
*   Crowdsourcing and Data Management
*   Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Data Models, Semantics, Query languages
*   Data Stream Systems and Edge Computing
*   Very Large Data Visualization and Interactive Data Exploration
*   Database Security and Privacy
*   Distributed Ledgers and Blockchains
*   Distributed, Parallel and P2P Data Management
*   Explainability, Fairness, and Trust in Data Systems and Analysis
*   Graphs, Networks, and Semi-structured Data Management
*   Information Integration and Data Quality
*   IoT Data Management
*   Modern Hardware and In-Memory Database Systems
*   Query Processing, Indexing, and Optimization
*   Transaction Management
*   Spatial Databases and Temporal Databases
*   Text, Semi-Structured Data Management, Multimedia Databases
*   Information Retrieval from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Uncertain, Probabilistic, and Approximate Databases
*   Very Large Data Science Applications/Pipelines
*   Workflows, Scientific Data Management

We also welcome any original contributions that may cross the boundaries among areas or point in other novel directions of interest to the database research community.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are **11:59 PM AoE**.

### First Round:

*   **Submission due:** **August 2, 2024**
*   **Notification for authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** **September 24, 2024**
*   **Revision due:** **October 29, 2024**
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** **November 26, 2024**
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** **December 10, 2024**

### Second Round:

*   **Submission due:** **November 25, 2024**
*   **Notification for Authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** **January 21, 2025**
*   **Revision Due:** **February 25, 2025**
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** **March 25, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** **April 8, 2025**

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission System:** Papers should be submitted using the Conference Management Tool: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025).
*   **Format:** Manuscripts must be prepared in accordance with the IEEE format available at [https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   **Length:** Research papers must not exceed **12 pages**, not including references. No appendix is allowed.
*   **File Format:** Only electronic submissions in **PDF format** will be considered.
*   **Originality:** A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 cannot be under review for any other conference or journal during the entire time it is considered for ICDE 2025, and it must be substantially different from any previously published work. Submissions must cite prior publications, even if below the 4-page length threshold.
*   **Author Limits:** Any author of ICDE 2025 should not be a co-author of more than **10 submitted research papers** across the two submission rounds.
*   **Reviewing:** Submissions will be reviewed in a **single-blind manner**. Papers rejected in the first round are not eligible for re-submission to the second round.
*   **Best Papers:** The best papers will be selected for submission as an extended version to be published in the **IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE)**.
*   **Presentation:** IEEE reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution if none of the authors attend the conference to present their paper.

## Desk Rejection Policy

Submissions that do not meet the following requirements may be rejected without review:

*   **Guidelines and Length:** Must follow guidelines and length requirements.
*   **Scope:** Must be in scope of ICDE 2025 and align with at least one topic area. Submissions purely advancing machine learning without data management aspects (scalability, efficiency) will be considered out of scope.
*   **Conflict of Interest (COI):** Authors must correctly declare all conflicts of interest with members of the program committee. Failure to do so, or frivolous declaration, will result in desk-rejection.
    *   **Declaration:** It is the responsibility of authors to identify and declare all COIs. A searchable spreadsheet of COIs is provided as a resource.
    *   **CMT Profile:** Each author must create a CMT profile and complete it with domain and individual conflicts. Papers with missing COI profiles for any author will be desk-rejected.

## Reviewing Process

*   Papers will be stringently reviewed with at least **3 reviews per paper**.
*   The review process will be coordinated by a meta-reviewer, leading to a decision (accept, reject, or revise).
*   **Revisions:** Papers may be invited for revision if the PC believes they can be reasonably improved within the allocated time (five weeks).

## Inclusions and Diversity in Writing

We value Diversity and Inclusion in our community and profession. Be mindful in your writing to avoid language or examples that further the marginalization, stereotyping, or erasure of any group of people. Reviewers will monitor and demand changes if such issues arise.

## Conflict of Interest (COI) Definition

An author X of an ICDE 2025 research paper has a COI with a PC member or Area Chair Y if any of the following conditions hold:
*   X is a co-author of another ICDE 2025 submission with Y.
*   X has co-authored publications with Y in the past three years.
*   X has co-authored 4 or more publications with Y in the last 10 years.
*   X has been a co-worker of Y in the same company or university within the past three years.
*   X has been a collaborator of Y within the past three years (e.g., held a joint grant).
*   X is or was Yâ€™s primary thesis advisor or vice versa.
*   X is a relative or a close personal friend of Y (or vice versa).

The onus for correctly declaring COIs rests with the authors.

callForPapers:
# IEEE International Conference on Global Software Engineering (ICGSE) - Call for Papers

*Note: The provided text appears to be for ICSE 2025, not ICGSE. The following Call for Papers is based on the ICSE 2025 information.* 

## ICSE 2025: Call for Papers

ICSE, the IEEE/ACM International Conference on Software Engineering, is the premier software engineering conference. ICSE 2025 will be held from **April 27 to May 3, 2025**, in **Ottawa, Ontario, Canada**. The core conference days were Wednesday, April 30 to Friday, May 2.

This page serves as a historical record. The proceedings are available [here](https://conf.researchr.org/info/icse-2025/proceedings).

## About ICSE 2025

ICSE provides a forum where researchers, practitioners, and educators gather to present and discuss research results, innovations, trends, experiences, and issues in the field of software engineering.

2025 marks the **50th anniversary of ICSE**, which was first held in 1975!

## Tracks

ICSE 2025 features a comprehensive program with various tracks, including:

*   Main Plenaries
*   Panels and Special Sessions
*   **Research Track**
*   Software Engineering in Practice (SEIP)
*   Software Engineering in Society (SEIS)
*   New Ideas and Emerging Results (NIER)
*   Journal-first Papers
*   Demonstrations
*   Artifact Evaluation
*   Industry Challenge Track
*   Software Engineering Education
*   Posters
*   Doctoral Symposium
*   Shadow PC
*   Workshops
*   Tutorials and Technical Briefings
*   New Faculty Symposium
*   Symposium on Software Engineering in the Global South (SEiGS)
*   SRC - ACM Student Research Competition
*   Social, Networking and Special Rooms
*   Meetings and BOFs
*   Student Mentoring Workshop (SMeW)
*   Student Volunteers

## Co-hosted Conferences

ICSE 2025 is co-hosted with several other conferences, including:

*   AST 2025 (Automation of Software Test)
*   CAIN 2025 (SE for Artificial Intelligence)
*   CHASE 2025 (Cooperative and Human Aspects of SE)
*   CSEE&T 2025 (Software Engineering Education)
*   FORGE 2025 (AI Foundation Models and SE)
*   FormaliSE 2025
*   ICPC 2025 (Program Comprehension)
*   ICSR 2025 (Software Reuse)
*   MOBILESoft 2025 (Mobile SE and Systems)
*   MSR 2025 (Mining Software Repositories)
*   SEAMS 2025 (Adaptive And Self-Managing Systems)
*   TechDebt 2025 (Technical Debt)

## Key Deadlines (for CAIN, a co-located event):

*   **Papers:** Sat, Nov 2, 2024
*   **Abstracts (Optional):** Sat, Nov 2, 2024
*   **Notifications:** Sun, Jan 12, 2025
*   **Camera-Ready:** Wed, Feb 5, 2025

## Registration and Attendance

*   **Registration:** [Online](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/registration) or in person.
*   **Virtual Attendance:** Available.
*   **Presenting:** Information for presenters can be found [here](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/Presenting).

## Venue Information

*   **Main Venue:** Rogers Centre, Ottawa (formerly Shaw Centre)
*   **Reception Venue:** National Arts Centre
*   **Getting Around Ottawa:** [Information available](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/gettingAroundOttawa)
*   **Travel:** Information on [travelling to Ottawa](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/Travelling) and [travel support](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/travel-support).

## Additional Information

*   [Sustainability](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/Sustainability)
*   [Code of Conduct](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/Code+of+Conduct)
*   [Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion Plan](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/Diversity+and+Inclusion+Plan)
*   [FAQ](https://conf.researchr.org/attending/icse-2025/faq)

## Contact

For questions, please use the [contact form](https://conf.researchr.org/contact/icse-2025).

# International Conference on Information and Communications Security (ICICS) 2025: Call for Papers

The 27th International Conference on Information and Communications Security (ICICS 2025) will be held in Nanjing, China, during **October 29-31, 2025**. It will be organized by Southeast University, China. The conference seeks submissions presenting novel contributions related to information and communication security.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of particular interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Access control
*   AI-based security and privacy
*   Anonymity
*   Applied cryptography
*   Attestation
*   Authentication and authorization
*   Biometrics security
*   Blockchain security and privacy
*   Cloud computing security
*   Critical infrastructure protection
*   Cyber-physical systems security
*   Cyber threat intelligence
*   Data security and privacy
*   Digital forensics
*   Digital rights management
*   Digital watermarking
*   Distributed systems security
*   Edge and fog computing security
*   Embedded systems security
*   Formal methods for security
*   Hardware security
*   Identity management
*   Information security management
*   Intrusion detection and prevention
*   Malware and unwanted software
*   Mobile security and privacy
*   Online safety and child protection
*   Online social media security, privacy, and trust
*   Operating systems security
*   Network security
*   Privacy enhancing technologies
*   Secure communication protocols
*   Secure information flow
*   Secure systems design and architectures
*   Security and privacy for the (Industrial) Internet of Things
*   Security and privacy of AI
*   Security visualization
*   Software and application security
*   Steganography and steganalysis
*   Trusted computing
*   Trust management and reputation
*   Web security and privacy

## Submission Rounds and Deadlines

The conference will have two rounds of submissions. All submissions must be received by 11:59 p.m. (Beijing Time: UTC/GMT +8.00) on the day of the corresponding deadline.

### First Round Submission

*   **Submission Deadline:** **March 9, 2025**
*   **Notification:** **April 28, 2025**

### Second Round Submission

*   **Submission Deadline:** **May 23, 2025**
*   **Notification:** **July 21, 2025**

## Awards

Springer sponsors ICICS 2025 with 1000 EUR for a **Best Paper Award** and a **Best Student Paper Award**.

# ICIAP 2025: Call for Papers

The 23rd International Conference on Image Analysis and Processing (ICIAP 2025) is organized biennially by CVPL, the Italian Member Society of the International Association for Pattern Recognition (IAPR). The conference will focus on both traditional and emerging trends in computer vision, pattern recognition, and image processing, addressing both theoretical and practical aspects.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** September 15-19, 2025
*   **Location:** Sapienza University of Rome, Rome, Italy
*   **Focus:** Computer vision, pattern recognition, and image processing.

## Key Topics

Special emphasis will be placed on the following topics:

*   Video Analysis and Understanding
*   Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
*   Deep Learning
*   Multiview Geometry and 3D Computer Vision
*   Image Analysis, Detection, and Recognition
*   Multimedia
*   Biomedical and Assistive Technology
*   Digital Forensics and Biometrics
*   Image Processing for Cultural Heritage
*   Robot and Vision
*   Brave New Ideas
*   AI and science
*   X-Realities
*   Embedded Vision

## Submission Instructions

*   All submissions will be handled electronically via the conferenceâ€™s CMT Website: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025)
*   Authors can download the template and instructions from the provided links: [Template Download](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025) or use the [Overleaf Template](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICIAPconf2025).
*   The maximum number of pages is **12 including references**.

## Review Process

Papers will be selected through a **double-blind review process**, taking into account originality, significance, clarity, soundness, relevance, and technical content. Each submission will be managed by two Area Chairs and reviewed by at least three reviewers.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in the ICIAP 2025 Conference Proceedings, which will be published by **Springer in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science series (LNCS)**.

## Additional Author Guidelines

*   **Double-blind review:** Do not provide information that may identify the authors in the acknowledgments or any other part of the paper. Violation of these guidelines may lead to rejection without review.
*   **Dual submissions:** Manuscripts must not have been previously published or accepted for publication in a substantially similar form. No publication substantially similar in content (defined as having 20 percent or more overlap) will be submitted to this or another conference, workshop, or journal during the review period. Violation will lead to rejection and reporting to the other venue.
*   **arXiv preprints:** arXiv preprints and university technical reports are not considered as publications and do not need to be cited, but authors may cite them.

## Important Dates

*   **First round paper submission:** **14 February 2025**
*   **First round notification to authors:** **31 March 2025**
*   **Second round paper submission:** **15 April 2025** (extended to **29 April 2025** AoE)
*   **Second round notification to authors:** **15 June 2025**
*   **Authorsâ€™ Registration deadline:** **30 June 2025**
*   **Early Bird registration deadline:** **30 June 2025**
*   **Camera Ready Submission:** **10 July 2025**
*   **Regular registration deadline:** **4 September 2025**

## Contact Information

For more information, please contact us at [info@iciap.org](mailto:info@iciap.org).
