callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

## Welcome to MICC 2025

The **2025 IEEE 17th Malaysia International Conference on Communications (MICC)**, themed **"Empowering Intelligent Connectivity,"** will be held from **27-28 August 2025**, at the **Grand Swiss-Belhotel Melaka, Malaysia**.

MICC is the premier platform for both international and local delegates to share their latest research advancements in the field of communications. This flagship biennial conference is fully sponsored by the **IEEE Malaysia Communication Society & Vehicular Technology Society Joint Chapter (ComSoc / VTS)**.

## Conference Scopes & Topics

We invite submissions covering the following areas, including but not limited to:

*   Next Generation Wireless & Mobile Communications
*   Software-Defined Networking (SDN) & Network Virtualization
*   Emerging Communication Technologies
*   IoT, AI & Smart Communication Networks
*   Green & Sustainable Communication Systems
*   Optical & Quantum Communications
*   Antenna Theory and Design
*   Electromagnetic Wave Propagation
*   RF Circuit Design and Systems
*   Wireless Communication Technologies
*   Simulation and Measurement Techniques

## Submission Guidelines

*   Accepted papers will be published in the **MICC2025 Conference Proceeding** and submitted to **IEEE Xplore** for their consideration.
*   The proceedings will also be submitted for indexing and available at major academic databases such as **SCOPUS**.
*   Submissions should be made through the **EDAS system**.
*   **Authors Guidelines** can be found at: [https://micc2025.mycomvt.info/authors-guidelines/](https://micc2025.mycomvt.info/authors-guidelines/)

## Important Dates

*   **Full Paper Submission Deadline (2nd Extension):** **15 JUNE 2025**
*   **Acceptance Notification:** 1 June 2025
*   **Early Bird Registration Deadline:** **7 JULY 2025**
*   **Camera Ready with Payment Deadline:** **31 JULY 2025**
*   **Conference Date:** **27-28 AUGUST 2025**

## Awards & Recognition

*   Compete for prestigious honors, including the **Best Paper Award**, **Best Presenter Award**, and more!

## Student Grants

*   **IEEE ComSoc/VTS student members** are eligible to apply for exclusive grants.

## Registration

*   Information regarding registration can be found at: [https://micc2025.mycomvt.info/registration/](https://micc2025.mycomvt.info/registration/)

## Organizer

*   **Organizer:** IEEE Malaysia Communication Society & Vehicular Technology Society Joint Chapter (ComSoc / VTS)
*   **Organizing Partner:** Yayasan Universiti Multimedia
*   **Supported By:** Tourism Melaka

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers

The 29th International Conference on Methods and Models in Automation and Robotics (MMAR 2025) will take place in **MiÄ™dzyzdroje, Poland**, between **Tuesday, August 26th and Friday, August 29th, 2025**.

## Invitation

The conference provides an excellent opportunity to highlight new results and directions in automation and robotics theory, technology, and applications. It aims to bring together engineers and scientists from academia, research institutes, and industry.

## Topics of Interest

The topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   **Identification, modelling and simulation**
    *   Linear and nonlinear systems
    *   Distributed parameter systems
    *   Hybrid systems
    *   Computer aided systems design
    *   Uncertain systems
    *   Stochastic systems
*   **Signal processing**
    *   Filtering
    *   Sensor and signal fusion
    *   Adaptive signal processing
    *   Optimization in signal processing
    *   Wavelets
    *   Reconstruction of signals
    *   Change detection problems
    *   Time-frequency analysis
    *   Image processing
*   **Control and systems theory**
    *   Linear and nonlinear systems and control
    *   Fractional order systems
    *   Cooperative, coordinated and decentralized control
    *   Advanced process control
    *   Chaotic systems
*   **Robotics**
    *   Fundamentals of robotics
    *   Robotics applications
    *   Human-robot interaction
    *   Motion planning and algorithms
    *   Advanced robotics
    *   Kinematics and dynamics aspects of robots
    *   Nonholonomic systems and control
    *   Sensory and visual feedback in robots
*   **Intelligent systems and methods**
    *   Optimization algorithms
    *   Fuzzy systems
    *   Genetic algorithms
    *   Neural networks
    *   Decision support systems
    *   Machine learning
    *   Distributed control systems
    *   Networked control systems
    *   Software agents
    *   Planning and scheduling problems
    *   Fault detection and diagnosis
*   **Control systems**
    *   Adaptive control
    *   Predictive control
    *   Robust control
    *   Optimal control
    *   Control applications
    *   Marine and aerospace guidance and control
    *   Space control systems

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Paper Length:** Papers must be between **4 and 6 pages** long. Only papers within this length range will be accepted.
*   **Submission Site:** Submissions must be made via [https://epapers2.org/mmar2025](https://epapers2.org/mmar2025).
*   **Template:** Please use the correct template, available on the [Epapers site](https://epapers.org/mmar2021/ESR/samples.php) and in the [Submissions tab](http://mmar.edu.pl/index.php/submission/submission-information/).
*   **Author Commitment Statement:** Authors must adhere to the rules regarding citations, plagiarism, and paper presentation. Please review the [Author Commitment Statement](http://mmar.edu.pl/index.php/submission/author-commitment-statement/).

## Important Dates

*   **Final deadline for full paper submission:** **April 7, 2025**
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **May 19, 2025**
*   **Author Registration and Payment:** **June 20, 2025**
*   **Camera-Ready Paper Submission:** **June 20, 2025**
*   **Deadline for Online Presentation Submission:** **August 15, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **August 26-29, 2025**

## Participation Options

MMAR 2025 offers both **on-site** and **online** participation. Participants can choose their preferred way of participation in the registration form. Technical requirements for online presentations can be found in the [ONLINE PARTICIPATION](https://mmar.edu.pl/index.php/online-participation/) section.

## Publication

The conference program and abstracts will be published as a booklet with an ISBN. Full papers will be published on an accompanying USB. The proceedings will be submitted for review and approval for inclusion in the **IEEE XploreÂ® Digital Library** and are indexed in **Web of Science** and **SciVerse Scopus**.
note: (Type: Hybrid) We’re aware some of the authors may have objections against travelling and attending the event on-site. For those, we make it possible to participate in the conference online – presenting their papers and taking part in all sessions by means of video conference. Please choose your preferred way of participation in the registration form. We still hope most of you will decide to arrive and enjoy the conference on-site.

callForPapers:
# MobiCom 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM MobiCom conference seeks significant research contributions in the field of wireless networking and mobile computing. MobiCom 2025 emphasizes novel ideas, rigorous analysis, system design, and real-world measurement or deployment. The conference will have a broader and more inclusive view of wireless and mobile systems research, valuing novelty and creativity in techniques, system designs, implementations, and applications. Papers that support reproducibility with datasets, tools, and code, and discuss limitations are favored.

### Special Categories

MobiCom 2025 will have separate categories for **challenge, experience, and verification papers**, which are full papers providing detailed technical insights from real-world deployments.

## Topics

We invite submissions on a wide range of mobile computing, mobile systems, mobile applications, and wireless networking research, including but not limited to:

*   Edge and cloud computing
*   Embedded and energy-harvesting systems
*   Backscatter communication and wireless power
*   Implantable and wearable computing
*   Millimeter-wave and terahertz communications
*   Mobile health
*   Applications of machine learning (on-device ML, federated/decentralized ML) to mobile/wireless research
*   Transfer learning and domain adaptation for mobile applications
*   Large language models (LLMs) and generative AI for mobile and wireless systems
*   Next generation of mobile networks (5G, 6G and beyond)
*   Mobile web, video, virtual reality, augmented reality and other applications
*   Novel applications of wireless signals
*   Practical quantum applications and systems (quantum sensing, quantum programming, quantum machine learning, etc.)
*   Vehicular, robotic and drone-based networking
*   Communication with reconfigurable and intelligent reflective surfaces, meta materials, and flexible surfaces
*   Satellite networks and integrated satellite-terrestrial networks
*   Security and privacy issues/solutions for mobile/wireless systems
*   Sensing with radio, light, sound, and acoustics
*   Smart cities and smart spaces (e.g. smart factories, smart workspace, smart agriculture, urban mobility)
*   Ubiquitous computing and mobile human-computer interaction
*   Underwater networking and sensing
*   Visible light communications
*   Wireless localization and tracking
*   Reducing carbon footprint of wireless networks and mobile devices

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Format:** PDF, no more than **twelve (12) single-spaced and numbered pages** (excluding bibliography). Font size no smaller than 10pt. Double column format. US letter-sized paper (8.5 inches by 11 inches).
*   **Anonymity:** Submissions must be double-blind. Authors' names, affiliations, and acknowledgments must not appear anywhere in the paper or PDF file. Avoid self-identifying references. PDF file must not contain embedded hyperlinks.
*   **Submission Website:** [MobiCom 2025 paper submission website](https://mobicom25.hotcrp.com/)
*   **Experience Papers:** Prefix title with â€˜Experience Paper:â€™.
*   **File Size Limit:** Less than 15 MB.
*   **Templates:** [Latex](https://www.acm.org/publications/authors/templates) and [Word](https://www.acm.org/publications/authors/templates) templates are available.

## Submission Policy

*   **Previous Publications:** Submissions extending prior work (e.g., posters, demos, workshop papers) are allowed, but must acknowledge the prior work anonymously and explain differences.
*   **No Simultaneous Submissions:** Papers must be original and not under review elsewhere.
*   **Conflict of Interest (CoI):** Authors must identify all CoIs with PC members during submission.
*   **Previous Submissions:** For resubmissions or previously rejected papers, authors must report major concerns from previous reviews and how they were addressed, maintaining anonymity.

## Important Dates

**Summer Deadlines:**

*   Abstract Registration: **August 29, 2024** 23:59 AoE
*   Paper Submission: **September 5, 2024** 23:59 AoE
*   Early Notification: **October 25, 2024**
*   Final Notifications: **December 10, 2024**

**Winter Deadlines:**

*   Abstract Registration: **March 11, 2025** 23:59 AoE
*   Paper Submission: **March 18, 2025** 23:59 AoE
*   Early Notification: **May 10, 2025**
*   Final Notifications: **June 24, 2025**

## Review Process

*   **Double-blind reviewing.**
*   **One-shot Revision:** Papers may require specific revisions and can be resubmitted for the next deadline.
*   **Conditionally Accepted Papers:** Will undergo a rigorous shepherding process by a TPC member.

## Artifact Evaluation

Authors of accepted papers are invited to submit supporting materials for an Artifact Evaluation process. Successful participation earns badges on the papers.

## Presentation

*   Authors of accepted papers must submit a **one-minute video** introduction.
*   At least one author must register and attend the conference to present the paper.

## Awards

All accepted regular papers will be considered for the **Best Paper Award**.

## Contact Us

Program Co-Chairs: Ganesh Ananthanarayanan and Kate Lin
Email: [mobicom25-pc-chairs@acm.org](mailto:mobicom25-pc-chairs@acm.org)

## Sponsors

# Call for Papers: MMSP 2025

The IEEE 27th International Workshop on Multimedia Signal Processing (MMSP 2025) will be held from **September 21 to September 23, 2025**.

This workshop aims to convene researchers and practitioners from academia and industry dedicated to advancing the field of multimedia signal processing. Organized by the Multimedia Signal Processing Technical Committee of the IEEE Signal Processing Society (SPS), MMSP 2025 will feature a comprehensive technical program including oral sessions, poster sessions, special sessions, industry sessions, keynote speeches, invited talks, challenges, and panel discussions.

## Topics of Interest

We are particularly interested in contributions that address the following topics (submissions are not limited to these areas):

*   Multimedia with Generative Models
*   Multimedia Safety, Security, and Forensics in the AI Era
*   Multimedia with Self-Supervised Learning
*   Multimedia with Large-Scale Models
*   Multimedia with Big Data
*   Multimedia Communication

In addition to academic contributions, we welcome successful projects from research groups and industry companies to demonstrate their innovative ideas and products.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Instruction for Submission:** [https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/instruction-for-submission/](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/instruction-for-submission/)
*   **Presentation Guidelines:** [https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/presentation-guidelines/](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/presentation-guidelines/)

## Other Calls

*   [Call for Special Sessions](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/call-for-special-sessions/)
*   [Call for Industry Demos](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/call-for-industry-demos/)
*   [Call for Grand Challenges](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/call-for-grand-challenges/)
*   [Call for Rising Stars](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/rising-star/)

## Keynote Speakers

*   Helen Meng (IEEE Fellow, Professor of The Chinese University of Hong Kong, China)
*   Aggelos K Katsaggelos (IEEE Life Fellow, Professor of Northwestern University, USA)
*   Moncef Gabbouj (IEEE Fellow, Professor of Tampere University, Finland)
*   Alexander Lvovsky (OSA Fellow, Professor of University of Oxford, UK)
*   Xiaodong He (IEEE Fellow, VP and Head of AI Business JD.com, China)

## Thematic School

After the regular MMSP workshop, a thematic school will be held at Tsinghua University from **September 24 to September 26** with the theme â€œImmersive MultiMedia â€“ Capture, Reconstruction, Compression, Generation.â€ Students who register and attend the conference can join the school for free.

*   [About Thematic School](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/thematic-school/)

## Registration

*   [Register Now](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/registration/)

## Important Notices

*   China has recently optimized its visa-free transit policy. Individuals from 54 eligible countries traveling from China to a third country (region) can enter VISA-FREE through any of the 60 open ports and stay for no more than 240 hours. For more information, please visit the [Venue Page](https://attend.ieee.org/mmsp-2025/visa-free-policy/) or the Chinese Government Official website.

# MobileHCI 2025: Call for Papers

## Theme: Diving into Mobile AI

Drawing on Egyptâ€™s famous diving sites, this theme encourages deep exploration of how AI-driven mobile technologies can empower communities, from urban areas to rural regions to foster collective progress.

## About MobileHCI

The ACM International Conference on Mobile Human-Computer Interaction (MobileHCI) brings together people from diverse areas and provides a multidisciplinary forum for academics, hardware and software developers, designers and practitioners to discuss the challenges and potential solutions for effective interaction with and through mobile devices, applications, and services. The conference welcomes contributions that promote the exchange of ideas and rational discourse between academics, researchers, and industries all over the world.

MobileHCI'25 will be held in person from **September 22th - September 25th, 2025** in **Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt**.

callForPapers:
# MIS4TEL 2025: Call for Papers

The 15th International Conference on Methodologies and Intelligent Systems for Technology Enhanced Learning (MIS4TEL) will take place from **June 25th to 27th, 2025**, at the **University of Lille (France)**. MIS4TEL stands as a beacon, illuminating the path toward transformative methodologies in technology-enhanced learning (TEL).

## Submission Invitation

We extend a cordial invitation to researchers, designers, and domain experts to contribute their insights to the evolving narrative at the nexus of education and technology. MIS4TEL welcomes the submission of papers presenting original, relevant, and previously unpublished sound research results related to any of the conference topics. All submitted papers will undergo a thorough review process, with each paper being refereed by at least three experts in the field based on relevance, originality, significance, quality, and clarity.

## Tracks

*   **Main Track**
*   **Workshops**:
    *   Workshop on Integration of emerging technologies into education and training (ETELT)
    *   Workshop on Interactive Environments and Emerging Technologies for eLearning (IEETeL)
    *   Workshop on Technology Enhanced Learning in Nursing Education (NURSING)
    *   Workshop on Peer Review, Peer Assessment, and Self Assessment in Education (PRASAE)

## Paper Format and Submission Guidelines

*   **Maximum Length:**
    *   Full Papers: **12 pages** (including figures and references).
    *   Short Papers: **8 pages**.
*   **Templates:** Papers must be prepared according to the LNNS template of Springer (MS-WORD or LaTex format) without page numbers. Templates can be downloaded from the submission page.
*   **Submission:** All proposed papers must be submitted in electronic form (PDF format) using the [MIS4TEL conference management system](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=mis4tel25).
*   **Anonymization:** The MIS4TEL Main Track follows a double-blind peer review process. Authors must submit anonymized manuscripts that do not disclose their identity or affiliation.
*   **Camera-Ready Submission:** A ZIP file must be uploaded, including:
    *   A signed Copyright Form (**PDF format**).
    *   The final version of your paper (**MS-WORD or LaTeX format**).
    *   A document stating the changes performed taking into account the reviews, using the MIS4TEL conference management system.
*   **Consent to Publish:** For accepted papers, authors must fill out and sign the Consent to Publish.

## Publication

Accepted papers will be included in MIS4TEL Proceedings and published by **Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems series of Springer Verlag**. The books of this series are submitted to DBLP, INSPEC, Norwegian Register for Scientific Journals and Series, SCImago, SCOPUS, WTI Frankfurt eG, zbMATH, Google Scholar, and Springerlink.

## Special Issues

Authors of selected papers from MIS4TEL will be invited to submit an extended and improved version to special issues in different journals, including:

*   IJIMA journal
*   Logic Journal of the IGPL
*   ADCAIJ
*   Future Internet
*   Sensors journal
*   MDPI Systems Journal

## General Deadlines

*   **Submission Deadline:** **March 7, 2025**
*   (Workshop Deadlines: March 21, 2025 and March 31, 2025)
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** **April 25, 2025**
*   **Camera-Ready Papers:** **May 9, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** **June 25-27, 2025**

## Accommodation Grants

CRIStAL Lab offers 15 grants/awards to doctoral and young doctors. More information can be found [here](/open-calls/call-for-grants-awards).

## Contact Information

For inquiries, please contact: [info@mis4tel-conference.net](mailto:info@mis4tel-conference.net?subject=[MIS4TEL]%20Contact)

callForPapers:
# MISE 2025: Call for Papers

The **International Workshop on Modelling in Software Engineering (MISE)** is a workshop affiliated with ICSE 2025.

## About MISE

MISE is a workshop focused on research, practice, and challenges in **modelling in software engineering**. It aims to bring together researchers and practitioners to share their experiences and discuss the latest advancements in various modelling techniques and their applications in software engineering.

## About ICSE 2025

ICSE, the IEEE/ACM International Conference on Software Engineering, is the premier software engineering conference. ICSE 2025 was held from **April 27 to May 3, 2025**, in **Ottawa, Ontario, Canada**.

ICSE provides a forum where researchers, practitioners, and educators gather to present and discuss research results, innovations, trends, experiences, and issues in the field of software engineering.

## Tracks and Topics

MISE, as part of ICSE 2025, covers a range of topics related to modelling in software engineering. While specific MISE tracks are not detailed here, general ICSE tracks include:

*   Main Plenaries
*   Panels and Special Sessions
*   Research Track
*   SE In Practice (SEIP)
*   SE in Society (SEIS)
*   New Ideas and Emerging Results (NIER)
*   Journal-first Papers
*   Demonstrations
*   Artifact Evaluation
*   Industry Challenge Track
*   Software Engineering Education
*   Posters
*   Doctoral Symposium
*   Shadow PC
*   Workshops
*   Tutorials and Technical Briefings
*   New Faculty Symposium
*   Symposium on Software Engineering in the Global South (SEiGS)
*   SRC - ACM Student Research Competition
*   Social, Networking and Special Rooms
*   Meetings and BOFs
*   Student Mentoring Workshop (SMeW)
*   Student Volunteers

## Co-hosted Conferences and Workshops

ICSE 2025 also co-hosts several other conferences and workshops, including AST, CAIN, CHASE, CSEE&T, FORGE, FormaliSE, ICPC, ICSR, MOBILESoft, MSR, SEAMS, and TechDebt, along with numerous specialized workshops.

## Deadlines

Specific deadlines for MISE are not provided in this content. Please refer to the official MISE website or ICSE 2025 workshop listings for detailed information.

## Registration and Attendance

Information regarding registration, virtual attendance, venue details, and travel can be found on the main ICSE 2025 website.

callForPapers:
# MobiHoc 2025: Call for Papers

MobiHoc 2025, the 26th International Symposium on Theory, Algorithmic Foundations, and Protocol Design for Mobile Networks and Mobile Computing, will be held in **Houston, USA, October 27-30, 2025**.

MobiHoc is a premier international symposium dedicated to addressing challenges in dynamic networks and computing. This year, the conference's scope is significantly expanded to include theory, algorithms, and systems research on next-generation networking, communications, and related applications, aiming to foster bridges across different wireless subcommunities.

MobiHoc 2025 will feature a highly selective technical program, distinguished keynote addresses, an exciting panel, and workshops focused on areas of emerging interest.

## Important Dates

This conference aims to unite diverse groups of people from discrete and continuous optimization, working on both theoretical and applied aspects, fostering interaction among participants. callForPapers:
# MOPTA 2025: Call for Contributions

The Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering (ISE) at Lehigh University invites contributions and participation in the **Modelling and Optimization: Theory and Applications (MOPTA) 2025 Conference**. The event will take place in **Ponta Delgada, Azores, Portugal**, from **June 17-20, 2025**.

MOPTA aims to bring together a diverse group of people from both discrete and continuous optimization, working on both theoretical and applied aspects. The conference will feature a small number of invited talks from distinguished speakers and contributed talks, spread over three days.

## Special Celebrations

*   **70th Birthday of Professor TamÃ¡s Terlaky:** A dedicated Tamas-70 Session and Dinner will be held on **June 18, 2025**, to celebrate Professor Terlaky's significant contributions.
*   **Lehigh ISE 100th Anniversary:** The conference will also commemorate the 100th anniversary of Lehigh ISE.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract Deadline:** **Saturday, March 1, 2025**
*   **Registration Deadline:** **Tuesday, April 1, 2025**
*   **Late Registration Deadline:** **May 15, 2025** (tours and dinners may not be guaranteed)
*   **AIMMS-MOPTA Competition Deadline:** Extended to **Tuesday, April 1, 2025**

## Topics of Interest

Contributions are welcome in all areas of discrete and continuous optimization, encompassing both theoretical and applied aspects.

## Venue & Accommodation

Information regarding the venue and accommodation can be found at: [https://coral.ise.lehigh.edu/mopta2025/venue-tours-and-accommodation/](https://coral.ise.lehigh.edu/mopta2025/venue-tours-and-accommodation/)

## Registration

Details on registration can be found at: [https://coral.ise.lehigh.edu/mopta2025/registration/](https://coral.ise.lehigh.edu/mopta2025/registration/)

## Competition

Information about the AIMMS-MOPTA Competition is available at: [https://coral.ise.lehigh.edu/mopta2025/competition/](https://coral.ise.lehigh.edu/mopta2025/competition/)

## Related Events

*   **Portuguese American Optimization Workshop (PAOW):** A satellite event focusing on continuous optimization and its applications to machine learning, taking place in Horta, Azores, Portugal from June 13-15, 2025.

## Contact Information

*   **General Inquiries/Plenaries/Program/Abstracts:**
    *   Dr. Tommaso Giovannelli
*   **Competition Inquiries:**
    *   Dr. Akwum Onwunta

We look forward to welcoming you at MOPTA 2025!

# Call for Papers: MoMM 2025

The 23rd International Conference on Advances in Mobile Computing & Multimedia Intelligence (MoMM2025) invites researchers and practitioners to submit their work. The conference theme is **"Intelligent Mobile and Multimedia Solutions: Pioneering Ubiquitous Technologies for Social Impact"**.

MoMM2025 is a leading international conference that brings together researchers, practitioners, and industry experts in the field of mobile computing and multimedia intelligence. It provides a forum for presenting and discussing the latest research findings, trends, challenges, and opportunities related to these areas.

## Conference Details

*   **Dates:** 8 - 10 December 2025
*   **Location:** Matsue, Japan
*   **Format:** In-person only. All accepted papers must be presented at the conference by one of the authors.
*   **Endorsed by:** Web Applications Society (@WAS)
*   **Co-located with:** The 27th International Conference on Information Integration and Web Intelligence (iiWAS2025)

callForPapers:
# MEMOCODE: Call for Contributions

MEMOCODE is the ACM/IEEE International Symposium on Formal Methods and Models for System Design, focusing on the importance of models and methodologies in correct system design and development. The conference aims to bring together researchers and industry practitioners interested in all aspects of computer system development.

More information can be found on the [dedicated website](https://memocode2025.github.io).

## Submission Tracks

MEMOCODE covers a wide range of topics related to formal methods and models in system design, including but not limited to:

*   Formal methods for hardware and software design
*   Formal verification and validation
*   Modeling languages and techniques
*   Embedded systems design
*   Cyber-physical systems
*   System-on-chip (SoC) design
*   Hardware-software co-design
*   Real-time systems
*   Component-based design
*   Model-driven engineering

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract Submission:** April 28, 2025
*   **Full Paper Submission:** May 5, 2025
*   **Notification:** July 8, 2025
*   **Final Versions:** August 30, 2025

The conference will focus on the theory, systems, practices, and challenges of providing users with a successful mobile or wireless experience, including how mobile computing changes pervasive use of computers, computing resources, and applications, as well as the systems, services, and technology enabling these applications. MobiSPC 2025 will be held in conjunction with The 20th International Conference on Future Networks and Communications (FNC 2025). callForPapers:
# MobiSPC 2025: Call for Papers

The 22nd International Conference on Mobile Systems and Pervasive Computing (MobiSPC 2025) will be held in **Leuven, Belgium**, from **August 4-6, 2025**, in conjunction with The 20th International Conference on Future Networks and Communications (FNC 2025).

MobiSPC-2025 solicits papers that focus on the theory, system, practice, and challenges of providing users with a successful mobile or wireless experience. This includes how mobile computing changes how people pervasively use their computers, computing resources, and applications, as well as the systems, services, and technology enabling those applications.

MobiSPC-2025 aims to provide a scholarly forum for researchers, engineers, and students to share their state-of-the-art research and developmental work in the broad areas of pervasive computing and communications.

## Topics of Interest

The topics include but are not limited to:

### Agent Systems, Intelligent Computing and Applications
*   Adaptive agents
*   Agents architectures
*   Auctions and market-based systems
*   Collaborative multi-agent systems
*   Context models and context factors for ambient intelligence
*   Competitive multi-agent based systems
*   Cooperative multi-agent based systems
*   Coordination, Communication and Reasoning in Mobile Environments
*   Evolutionary computation in ambient systems
*   Mobile agents
*   Mobile Agent Architecture for Mobile Systems
*   Mobile Agent Middleware for Mobile Systems
*   Mobile Agent Security Properties in Mobile Environments
*   Modelling agents behaviours in ambient systems
*   Monitoring agents
*   Negotiating agents
*   Parallel Computing for Mobile Systems
*   Quantitative and Qualitative Characterization of Mobile Agents in Mobile Environments
*   Reasoning technology for ambient sensing
*   Robotics in ambient systems
*   Secure and trusted agents
*   Verification of Protocols and Algorithms for Mobile Agent/Code in Mobile Environments

### Big Data in Mobile and Pervasive Systems
*   Big data in pervasive systems
*   Big data in ubiquitous computing
*   Big data for telecommunication
*   Data analytics in mobile e-commerce
*   Grid Computing for big data
*   Mobile data mining
*   Mobile cloud computing for big data
*   Mobile phone sensing

### Component-based IoT
*   Cloud support for the IoT
*   Composition of IoT services and components
*   Distribution and binding models for IoT applications
*   Experiences applying component-based design to IoT systems
*   Interoperability of IoT services and components
*   Modelling, development and simulation support for the IoT
*   Modular hardware/software co-design
*   Modular or component based FPGA development
*   Novel component models for the IoT
*   Privacy of modular IoT systems
*   Security of modular IoT systems

### Cloud Computing
*   Advertisement
*   Computing Performance Evaluation
*   Contest Based Sensing
*   Data and Storage Architecture
*   Data Storage Management for Mobile Cloud Computing Service Provider and Users
*   Games
*   Multimedia Services
*   Privacy Protection
*   Quality of Experiences and (QoE) Studies
*   Security
*   Service Models
*   Service Platform
*   Software Development Platform and Enabled New Applications
*   Virtualization and Programmable Infrastructure

### Data Management
*   Context-aware Computing for Intelligent Mobile Services
*   Data Management for Emerging Smart Urban Systems
*   Data management for Next-Gen Mobile and Ad-Hoc Networks
*   Data Management for the Internet of Things (IoT)
*   Data Management in the Mobile Cloud
*   Data replication, migration and dissemination in mobile environments
*   Data stream processing in mobile/sensor network
*   Mobile Activity Recognition
*   Mobile Data Analytics
*   Mobile Data and User/Behavioural Understanding
*   Mobile Location-Based Social Networks
*   Mobile Situation Inference
*   Query Processing for moving objects/users
*   Recommendations for Mobile Users
*   Semantic Data Management for Mobile Devices/Applications
*   Transactions and workflows in mobile environments

### Enabling Technologies and Emerging Topics
*   Agents and Intelligent Computing
*   Big data
*   Cyber Physical Social Systems
*   Mobile Applications
*   Mobile Crowd-sourcing and Human-in-the-Loop Design
*   Mobile Services and Platforms
*   Mobile Sensor Based Personal Informatics
*   Mobile Web
*   Near Field Communication
*   New Mobile Sensing Hardware
*   Robotic Sensor Networking
*   Vehicular Social Networks
*   Wearable Augmented Reality Systems

### Internet of Things (IoT)
*   Data Mining on IoT systems
*   Edge Computing solutions for IoT
*   IoT applied to Cultural Heritage
*   IoT for e-health
*   IoT platforms for Data analytics on pervasive and mobile environments
*   IoT tools and applications
*   Network Design and Architecture
*   Sensor networks, Remote Diagnosis and Development

### Mobile Systems and Applications

### Pervasive Computing
*   Adaptive, Autonomic and Context-Aware Computing
*   Architectures, Protocols, and Technologies for Pervasive Communications
*   Cognitive Computing in Pervasive Systems
*   Context Modelling and Reasoning
*   Data Management for Pervasive Computing
*   Energy-Efficient and Green Pervasive Computing
*   Innovative Pervasive Computing Applications
*   Machine Learning for Activity Recognition
*   Middleware for Pervasive Services and Applications
*   Mobile/Wearable Computing Systems and Services in Pervasive Computing
*   Multimodal Sensing and Context for Pervasive Applications
*   Opportunistic Networking and Sensing in Pervasive Systems
*   Participatory and Social Sensing
*   Pervasive Computing Aspects of Social Networks
*   Positioning and Tracking Technologies
*   Programming Paradigms for Pervasive Systems
*   Sensors and RFID in Pervasive Systems
*   Smart Devices and Intelligent Environments
*   Social and Economic Models for Pervasive Systems
*   Software Evolution and Maintenance in Pervasive Systems
*   Trust, Security and Privacy Issues in Pervasive Systems
*   User Interface, Interaction, and Persuasion
*   Virtual Immersive Communications

### Smart Cities and Smart Communities

### Social Networking
*   MSN Advertising, Business to Business (B2B) Marketing
*   MSN Algorithms for Social Search
*   MSN Analytics
*   MSN Architecture
*   MSN Brand Management (social brand strategic development and product management)
*   MSN Data Mining and Machine Learning
*   MSN Infrastructure Support
*   MSN Marketing (digital, direct and mobile marketing)
*   MSN Privacy in Data Collection and Management
*   Trust and Reputations in MSN

## Important Dates

*   **Submission Deadline:** Please refer to the Call for Papers document or conference website for specific dates.
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** Please refer to the Call for Papers document or conference website for specific dates.
*   **Camera Ready Submission:** Please refer to the Call for Papers document or conference website for specific dates.

## Publication Information

All MobiSPC 2025 accepted papers will be published by **Elsevier Science** in the open-access **Procedia Computer Science** series online. Procedia Computer Science is hosted by Elsevier on www.Elsevier.com and on Elsevier content platform ScienceDirect (www.sciencedirect.com), and will be freely available worldwide.

All papers in Procedia will be indexed by:
*   Scopus (www.scopus.com)
*   Thomson Reuters' Conference Proceeding Citation Index (http://thomsonreuters.com/conference-proceedings-citation-index/)
*   Engineering Village (Ei) (www.engineeringvillage.com), including EI Compendex (www.ei.org/compendex).
*   DBLP (http://dblp.uni-trier.de/)

## Downloads

*   [Click Here to Download Call for Papers (Text)](./subPages/MobiSPC_CfP25.txt)
*   [Click Here to Download MobiSPC 2025 Flyer (PDF)](./subPages/MobiSPC25_Flyer.pdf)

## Contact Information

For inquiries, please refer to the contact information provided on the conference website or the "Mail Us" link.

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: MPLR 2025

The 22nd International Conference on Managed Programming Languages & Runtimes (MPLR 2025, formerly ManLang, originally PPPJ) is a premier forum for presenting and discussing novel results in all aspects of managed programming languages and runtime systems. These systems serve as building blocks for important computing systems, ranging from small-scale (embedded and real-time systems) to large-scale (cloud-computing and big-data platforms) and anything in between (desktop, mobile, IoT, and wearable applications).

MPLR 2025 accepts original research results that have not been published elsewhere. Each submitted paper receives a minimum of three reviews by program committee members. Papers are selected based on originality, relevance, technical clarity, and quality of presentation. At least one author of each accepted paper must register for MPLR 2025 and present the paper.

## Topics

The areas of interest include but are not limited to:

### Languages and Compilers
*   Managed languages (e.g., Java, Scala, JavaScript, Python, Ruby, C#, F#, Clojure, Groovy, Kotlin, R, Smalltalk, Racket, Rust, Go, Lua, MATLAB, Raku, Pony, â€¦)
*   Domain-specific languages
*   Language design
*   Compilers and interpreters
*   Type systems and program logics
*   Language interoperability
*   Parallelism, distribution, and concurrency

### Virtual Machines
*   Portable intermediate representations (e.g., JVM, WebAssembly, RPython, â€¦)
*   Managed runtime systems (e.g., GraalVM, Android Runtime (ART), V8, JavaScriptCore, .NET, â€¦)
*   VM design and optimization
*   VMs for mobile and embedded devices
*   VMs for real-time applications
*   Memory management and garbage collection
*   Hardware/software co-design
*   Persistence

### Techniques, Tools, and Applications
*   Static and dynamic program analysis
*   Testing and debugging
*   Refactoring
*   Program understanding
*   Program synthesis
*   Security and privacy
*   Performance analysis and monitoring
*   Compiler and program verification and model checking

For questions about the scope, please contact Program Chair Tomoharu Ugawa at ugawa@ci.i-u.ac.jp.

## Submission Categories

MPLR accepts three types of submissions:

*   **Regular research papers:** Describing novel contributions involving managed language platforms. Evaluated based on relevance, novelty, technical rigor, and contribution to the state-of-the-art.
    *   Format: **Up to 12 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix.
*   **Work-in-progress research papers:** Describing hot topics or promising new ideas with less maturity. Evaluated with an emphasis on novelty and potential of new ideas.
    *   Format: **Up to 6 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix.
*   **Industry and tool papers:** Presenting technical challenges and solutions for managed language platforms in deployed applications and systems. Evaluated on relevance, usefulness, and results. Suitability for demonstration and availability will also be considered for tool papers.
    *   Format: **Up to 6 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix; up to **12 pages** allowed if justified by the content.

Accepted submissions will be published in the ACM Digital Library, unless authors opt-out.

MPLR 2025 adheres to the ACM Policy on Prior Publication and Simultaneous Submissions and the SIGPLAN Republication Policy.

MPLR 2025 does not hold its own poster session; please consider submitting to the SPLASH poster track.

## Author Instructions

*   Submissions must use the **ACM SIGPLAN format** with the `sigplan` style.
*   **LaTeX:** Use the `acmart` document class with the `sigplan` option (not `sigconf`). The `samples/sample-sigplan.tex` file in the `acmart-primary.zip` from ACM's template page is a guide. On Overleaf, change the `manuscript` documentclass option to `sigplan`.
*   For ease of reviewing, include page numbers using `\settopmatter{printfolios=true}`.
*   Submissions must be in **PDF format**.
*   MPLR uses **double-blind reviewing**. Authors must not show their names and should refer to their own work in the third person. Avoid publicizing the work under the same or similar title while under review.
*   Ensure legibility when printed in black and white (colors distinct, font sizes legible).

## Important Dates

*   **Paper Submission Deadline:** **June 24, 2025** (Extended from June 11, 2025)
*   **Paper Author Notification:** **July 28, 2025**
*   **Camera Ready for Papers:** **August 25, 2025**
*   **Conference Date:** **October 14, 2025**

All deadlines are 23:59 AoE (UTC-12h).

## Submission Site

[https://mplr25.hotcrp.com](https://mplr25.hotcrp.com)

## Program Committee

callForPapers:
# MSR 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Mining Software Repositories (MSR) is the premier conference for data science (DS), machine learning (ML), and artificial intelligence (AI) in software engineering. The MSR conference invites significant research contributions in which software data plays a central role.

The 22nd International Conference on Mining Software Repositories will be held on **April 28-29, 2025, in Ottawa, Canada.**

## Submission Types and Evaluation Criteria

We invite both **full papers** (maximum ten pages, plus two additional pages of references) as well as **short papers** (four pages, plus references) to the Research Track.

Submissions will be evaluated according to the following criteria:

*   **Soundness:** How well the paperâ€™s contributions address the research questions and are backed by relevant research procedures.
*   **Relevance:** The extent to which the paperâ€™s contributions address a significant knowledge gap or crucial practical issue within software engineering.
*   **Novelty:** How original the paperâ€™s contributions are.
*   **Presentation:** Clarity, legibility of figures/tables, and adequacy of English language usage.
*   **Replicability:** The extent to which the paperâ€™s claims can be independently verified.

## Junior PC Program

MSR 2025 will integrate junior reviewers into the Technical track program committee to train early-career researchers in the academic peer-review process. All submissions to the MSR research track will be reviewed jointly by both regular and junior PC members.

## Submission Process

*   Submissions must conform to the **IEEE conference proceedings template**.
*   All submissions must not exceed **10 pages** for the main text, inclusive of all figures, tables, appendices, etc. **Two more pages** containing only references are permitted. Accepted papers will be allowed one extra page for the camera-ready version.
*   Submissions must be in **PDF format**.
*   Submissions must adhere to the **ACM Policy and Procedures on Plagiarism** and the **IEEE Plagiarism FAQ**.
*   Papers must not have been published elsewhere and must not be under review or submitted for review elsewhere whilst under consideration for MSR 2025.
*   Authors must adhere to the **ACM Publications Policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects** and the **authorship policies of ACM and IEEE**.
*   The MSR 2025 Technical Track will employ a **double-anonymous review process**. Authorsâ€™ identities must be omitted, and references to prior work should be in the third person.
*   Authors must include a supporting statement on **data availability** per the Open Science policy.

## Open Science Policy

Authors are expected to disclose:

*   The source code of relevant software.
*   The data used in the paper (anonymized and curated).
*   Instructions for reproducing or replicating the results.

Artifacts should be archived on preserved digital repositories (e.g., zenodo.org, figshare.com) and released under a recognized open data license.

## Important Dates

*   **Abstract Deadline:** November 6, 2024 (AoE)
*   **Paper Deadline:** November 9, 2024 (AoE)
*   **Author Response Period:** December 12 â€“ 15, 2024 (AoE)
*   **Author Notification:** January 12, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Camera Ready Deadline:** February 05, 2025 (AoE)

## Accepted Papers and Attendance Expectation

At least one author of each accepted paper is required to register for MSR 2025 and present the paper.

## Submission Link

Papers must be submitted through HotCRP: [https://msr2025-technical.hotcrp.com/](https://msr2025-technical.hotcrp.com/)

## MSR 2025 Tracks

*   Data and Tool Showcase Track
*   FCA Award
*   Industry Track
*   Junior PC
*   Keynotes
*   MIP Award
*   MSR Awards
*   Mining Challenge
*   Program
*   Registered Reports
*   Technical Papers
*   Tutorials
*   Vision and Reflection

summary: The Usenix Network and Distributed System Security Symposium (NDSS) is a leading security forum for researchers and practitioners. The NDSS Symposium 2026 will be held in San Diego, California, from February 23-27, 2026, focusing on practical aspects of network and distributed system security.
callForPapers:
# NDSS Symposium 2026: Call for Papers

The Network and Distributed System Security (NDSS) Symposium is a premier venue that fosters information exchange among researchers and practitioners of network and distributed system security. The NDSS Symposium 2026 and its co-located workshops will take place in **San Diego, CA, from 23 to 27 February 2026**.

The symposium targets individuals interested in practical aspects of network and distributed system security, with a focus on system design and implementation. A key goal is to encourage and enable the Internet community to apply, deploy, and advance practical security technologies.

## Submission Cycles

NDSS Symposium 2026 will feature two review cycles:

*   **Summer Cycle**
*   **Fall Cycle**

All submissions must be received by **11:59 PM AoE (UTC-12)** on the day of the corresponding deadline.

## Review Process

Submissions will undergo a two-round review process. Potential decisions include:

*   **Accept:** Accepted for publication and presentation.
*   **Minor Revision:** Accepted upon satisfactory minor revisions.
*   **Major Revision:** Promising but requires additional work; authors may revise and resubmit within a specified timeframe.
*   **Reject:** Not allowed for resubmission.

Authors will receive early notification with Round 1 reviews and an opportunity for rebuttal and interactive discussion with reviewers.

## New Guidelines Summary

*   **Bulk Submission Limitation:** Each author can be listed on a maximum of **six (6) submissions per cycle** (12 total).
*   Authors cannot be added to a submission after the deadline.
*   Wide advertisement of the paper during the review process is disallowed.
*   Major overlap between a rejected paper from the summer cycle and a submission to the fall cycle is disallowed.

## Paper Submission Information

*   **Artifact Evaluation:** Authors of accepted papers are strongly encouraged to open-source their artifacts and submit them for an artifact evaluation.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are on Wednesdays, 11:59 PM AoE (UTC-12):

### Summer Cycle

*   **Paper submission deadline:** Wed, 23 April 2025
*   **Early reject/Round 2 notification & Round 1 reviews:** Wed, 28 May 2025
*   **Author rebuttal:** Wed, 18 Jun to Fri, Jun 20, 2025
*   **Interactive discussion with reviewers:** Wed, 18 June to Wed, 25 June 2025
*   **Author notification:** Wed, 2 July 2025
*   **Resubmission of Major Revision papers / Minor Revision decision:** Wed, 30 July 2025
*   **Author notification for Major Revision:** Wed, 13 August 2025
*   **Camera Ready deadline:** Wed, 10 September 2025

### Fall Cycle

*   **Paper submission deadline:** Wed, 6 August 2025
*   **Early reject/Round 2 notification & Round 1 reviews:** Wed, 17 September 2025
*   **Author rebuttal:** Wed, 8 October to Fri, 10 October 2025
*   **Interactive discussion with reviewers:** Wed, 8 October to Wed, 15 October 2025
*   **Author notification:** Wed, 22 October 2025
*   **Resubmission of Major Revision papers / Minor Revision decision:** Wed, 19 November 2025
*   **Author notification for Major Revision:** Wed, 3 December 2025
*   **Camera Ready deadline:** Wed, 17 December 2025

## Areas/Topics of Interest

Submissions are solicited in, but not limited to, the following areas:

*   Anti-malware techniques: detection, analysis, and prevention
*   Cyber attack (e.g., APTs, botnets, DDoS) prevention, detection, investigation, and response
*   Cyber-crime defense and forensics (e.g., anti-phishing, anti-blackmailing, anti-fraud techniques)
*   Integrating security in network protocols (e.g., routing, naming, and management)
*   Mobile and wireless network security
*   Network security policy implementation, deployment, and management
*   Privacy and anonymity in networks and distributed systems
*   Public key infrastructures, key management, certification, and revocation
*   Security and privacy for blockchains and cryptocurrencies
*   Security and privacy of mobile/smartphone platforms
*   Security and privacy of operating systems, hypervisors, and virtual machines
*   Security and privacy of systems based on machine learning, federated learning, AI, and large language models
*   Security for cloud/edge computing
*   Security for cyber-physical systems (e.g., autonomous vehicles, industrial control systems)
*   Security for emerging networks (e.g., smart homes, IoT, body-area networks, VANETs)
*   Security for future Internet architectures and designs (e.g., Software-Defined Networking, Intent-Based Networking)
*   Security for large-scale, critical infrastructures (e.g., electronic voting, smart grid)
*   Security of web-based applications and services (e.g., social networking, crowd-sourcing, fake news/disinformation), web security and privacy
*   Software/firmware/hardware security analysis, customization, and extensions
*   Special problems and case studies: e.g., tradeoffs between security and efficiency, usability, cost, and ethics
*   Trustworthy computing software and hardware to secure networks and systems
*   Usable security and privacy
*   Systematization of knowledge (SoK-papers) are also within scope, provided they offer new insights and compelling evidence.

## Topic Fit

Submissions must have a clear relation to real systems, networks, and their applications. Papers with questionable fit, such as those focused solely on theoretical cryptography without implementation, mathematical proofs without evaluation, or contributions primarily in other fields (e.g., AI, ML) without a security/privacy contribution, may be desk-rejected.

## Review Goals

Reviews aim to provide concrete steps for improving work, distinguish reviewer opinion from demonstrable technical weaknesses, and offer clear citations for novelty claims.

## Paper Formatting

*   **Length:** Not exceeding **13 pages**, excluding the "Ethics Considerations" section, references, or appendices.
*   **Size:** US letter size (not A4).
*   **Layout:** Two-column layout.
*   **Font:** Times, 10-point or larger, with 11-point or larger line spacing.
*   **Templates:** Use the [NDSS templates](https://www.ndss-symposium.org/ndss2025/submissions/templates/) (2025 templates provided, 2026 templates to be published).
*   **Format:** Must be Portable Document Format (.pdf).
*   **Ethics Considerations:** An optional section can be included immediately preceding the reference section.

## Double and Concurrent Submissions

Technical papers must not substantially overlap with papers published or simultaneously submitted to other venues. Double submissions will lead to immediate rejection.

## Ethical Considerations

Authors may optionally include an "Ethics Considerations" section to discuss potential ethical risks and mitigation steps. If a paper involves human subjects, data derived from humans, or might pose risks, authors should discuss ethical and legal concerns, and whether an ethics review (e.g., IRB approval) was conducted. Responsible disclosure plans for high-impact vulnerabilities are encouraged.

## Anonymous Submissions

NDSS Symposium uses a **double-blind reviewing process**. Author names and affiliations must not appear in the paper. Authors should avoid revealing their identities in the text, figures, photos, links, or other data. Prior work must be referenced in the third person or blinded. Submissions violating anonymity will be rejected without review. Advertising results broadly is disallowed.

## Conflicts of Interest

Authors and Program Committee members must declare any conflicts of interest (e.g., advisors/advisees, institutional relationships, recent collaborations). PC members with conflicts will be excluded from evaluating the relevant papers. "Fake conflicts" are disallowed.

## Use of Generative AI

Generative AI is permitted for paper preparation provided it does not plagiarize or misrepresent content, and authors accept responsibility for veracity. Disclosure is required, commensurate with usage. Specific tools, versions, and prompts should be documented for significant use.

summary: The 11th IEEE International Conference on Network Softwarization (IEEE NetSoft 2025) will be held in Budapest, Hungary, from June 23 to June 27, 2025. The conference focuses on the transition of network infrastructure from hardware appliances to software, driven by technologies like NFV, SDN, and SFC, with a theme of "Sustainable and secure networks for distributed AI and compute". It will feature technical paper presentations, keynotes, panels, tutorials, workshops, demos, posters, and PhD symposiums.
callForPapers:
# Call for Papers: IEEE NetSoft 2025

## "Sustainable and secure networks for distributed AI and compute"

The **11th IEEE International Conference on Network Softwarization (IEEE NetSoft 2025)** will be held from **June 23 to June 27, 2025**, in **Budapest, Hungary**.

NetSoft 2025 addresses advanced research challenges and opportunities in network "softwarization," the transition from legacy network infrastructures and functionalities provided via hardware appliances to new ones provided via software. This is enabled by technologies such as network function virtualization, software-defined networking, and service function chaining.

The conference will feature technical paper presentations, keynotes, panels, tutorials, workshops, demos, posters, and PhD symposiums.

## Topics of Interest

The conference is soliciting paper submissions with significant research contributions to network softwarization. The topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   **Network softwarization for:**
    *   5G/6G
    *   network slicing and slice management
    *   Internet of Things (IoT)
    *   QoS and QoE
    *   Service Function Chaining (SFC)
    *   cognitive and autonomic networking
    *   policy-based and Intent-based networking
    *   eXtended Reality (AR/VR/ER and digital twins)
    *   Future Internet and New IP architectures
    *   new value chains and service models
    *   dynamic resource discovery and negotiation schemes
    *   cooperative multi-domain, multi-tenant SDN/NFV environments
    *   deterministic or dependable networking
    *   high-precision communications and computing
    *   Internet re-engineering
*   Security, Safety, Trust, and Privacy
*   Programmable SDN and NFV: languages and architectures (P4 and others)
*   Open source
*   Softwarized cloud, fog, and edge infrastructures
*   Resilience, reliability, and robustness
*   Assurance and Measurements
*   Abstractions and virtualization of resources, services, and functions
*   Sustainability, energy efficiency, and carbon emissions
*   Programmable Networking Protocols
*   Deployment and transition strategies
*   Experience reports from experimental testbeds and deployments
*   Hardware acceleration
*   Artificial intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) techniques
*   Applications of Generative AI
*   Socio-economic impact and regulations
*   Development methodologies (DevOps, NetOps, Verification)

## Paper Submission

*   **Types:** Technical Papers can be either **Full** or **Short** papers.
*   **Length:** Full papers are up to **9 pages**, and Short papers are up to **5 pages**, including references and all other material.
*   **Format:** All submissions must use the standard **IEEE two-column conference template**, available at: [https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   **Submission:** All manuscripts must be electronically submitted through **EDAS**. 
    *   Submission link: [Submit a Paper](https://edas.info/N30343) (Note: This is a common EDAS submission link for IEEE conferences, actual link might vary but EDAS is the platform).
*   **Policy:** NetSoft 2025 enforces a strict publication & no-show policy. By submitting a contribution, you agree with the terms.

## Important Dates

*   **Paper submission deadline:** **January 7, 2025** (Extended to **January 31, 2025** - Final)
*   **Acceptance notification:** **March 20, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready paper:** **April 28, 2025**

## Co-Chairs

*   **TPC CO-CHAIRS:**
    *   Carol Fung, Concordia University, Canada
    *   Massimo Tornatore, Politecnico di Milano, Italy
    *   Robert Szabo, Ericsson, Hungary
*   **GENERAL CO-CHAIRS:**
    *   Pal Varga, Budapest University of Technology and Economics, Hungary
    *   Walter Cerroni, University of Bologna, Italy

callForPapers:
# EAI MobiQuitous 2025: Call for Papers

The 22nd EAI International Conference on Mobile and Ubiquitous Systems: Computing, Networking and Services (EAI MobiQuitous 2025) will be held from **November 7-9, 2025**, in **Shanghai, China**.

## Why Attend?

Join EAI MobiQuitous 2025 to explore cutting-edge research and address key challenges in Mobile and Ubiquitous Computing, including security and human-machine interaction. This conference brings together experts to exchange ideas, collaborate, and shape the future of systems, applications, networks, and services in this dynamic field.

## Scope and Topics

Despite nearly two decades of extensive research in the field of Mobile and Ubiquitous Computing, many challenges still remain, especially concerning security considerations and human-machine interfaces. EAI MobiQuitous 2025 aims to be a forum for presenting and discussing high-quality research, fostering collaboration, and identifying future research directions. The conference covers systems, applications, social networks, middleware, networking, sensing, data management, data processing, and services, with a special focus on mobile and ubiquitous computing.

## Topics of Interest

*   Mobile User Experience
*   Security and Privacy
*   User Behaviour Analysis and Modelling
*   Crowdsourcing â€“ Platforms and Applications
*   Internet of Things â€“ Systems, Platforms, Data Analytics, and Applications
*   Context-awareness middleware
*   Mobile edge and fog computing
*   Urban/mobile Crowd-sensing
*   Participatory Sensing
*   Wireless Access Technologies
*   Performance Analysis, Modelling and Measurement of Mobile Networks
*   Wearable Computing
*   Body Area Networks
*   Cellular IoT
*   5G and 6G mobility
*   Mobile Data Analysis and Mobile Platforms
*   Mobile Multimedia
*   Mobile User Interfaces and Interaction Technologies
*   Toolkit and Languages for Mobile Computing
*   Networked Sensing and Applications
*   Mobile Device Architectures
*   Mobile Systems and Applications
*   Mobile Data Management and Analytics
*   Energy Aware Mobile Computing
*   Pervasive Sensing
*   Localization and Tracking
*   Activity Recognition
*   Social Network Applications to Mobile Computing
*   Context and Location-based Applications and Services
*   AI and Machine Learning Algorithms and Application for Mobile Computing
*   Mobile Augmented Reality/Mixed Reality
*   Mobile Cloud Computing
*   Digital Twins
*   Edge Intelligence
*   Internet of Vehicles
*   Formal Verification for Mobile and Ubiquitous System
*   Federated Learning
*   Blockchain Applications to Mobile and Ubiquitous Computing

## Submission Guidelines

### How to Submit a Paper:

1.  Go to the [EAI Confy+ website](https://confyplus.eai.eu/).
2.  Log in or sign up as a new user.
3.  Select your desired track.
4.  Click the â€˜Submit Paperâ€™ link within the track and follow the instructions.

### General Guidelines:

*   All papers must be submitted in English.
*   Previously published work or work concurrently submitted to other venues will be rejected.
*   Papers must adhere to the [Springer formatting guidelines](https://mobiquitous.eai-conferences.org/2025/author-s-kit/).
*   Authors must agree to the [Publication Ethics and Malpractice Statement](https://eai.eu/about/publications/publication-ethics/).
*   All figures, illustrations, tables, and images should have descriptive text (Alt Text) as per new EU accessibility requirements. Refer to [HOW TO WRITE GOOD ALT TEXT](https://icmtel.eai-conferences.org/2025/wp-content/uploads/sites/950/2024/11/How-to-Write-Good-Alt-Text-2.pdf?swcfpc=1).

### Paper Length:

*   **Regular papers:** up to 12-20 pages.
*   **Short papers:** 6-11 pages.

### Review Process:

All papers undergo a thorough peer review process, enhanced by EAI Community Review. Technical Program Committee members are responsible for review assignments and final acceptance decisions.

## Authorâ€™s kit â€“ Instructions and Templates

Papers must be formatted using the [Springer LNICST Authorsâ€™ Kit](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/book-author-data/book-author-data-on-springers-author-and-editor- à®¤à®³à®¤à¯à®¤à®¿à®²à¯). Instructions and templates are available from Springerâ€™s LNICST homepage:

*   [LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/book-author-data/book-author-data-on-springers-author-and-editor- à®¤à®³à®¤à¯à®¤à®¿à®²à¯)
*   [Microsoft Word Proceedings Templates](https://www.springer.com/gp/authors-editors/book-author-data/book-author-data-on-springers-author-and-editor- à®¤à®³à®¤à¯à®¤à®¿à®²à¯)

When uploading the camera-ready copy, please provide both a PDF copy and an archive file (e.g., zip, tar.gz) containing the PDF and LaTeX or Word source material.

## Deadlines

### Main Track

*   **Full Paper Submission deadline:** **15th June, 2025** ([Submission open](https://confyplus.eai.eu/app#conftrack-overview/cid/53693))
*   **Notification deadline:** **7th September, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** **7th October, 2025**

### Main Track â€“ Round 2

*   **Full Paper Submission deadline:** **20 July, 2025** ([Submission open](https://confyplus.eai.eu/app#conftrack-overview/cid/53693/tid/4956))
*   **Notification deadline:** **7 September, 2025**
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** **7 October, 2025**

### Late Track

*   **Full Paper Submission deadline:** 10th July 2024 (Submission closed)
*   **Notification deadline:** 1st August 2024
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** 20th August 2024

### Workshops

*   **Workshop Paper Submission deadline:** **31st July 2025**
*   **Notification deadline:** **7th September 2025**
*   **Camera-ready deadline:** **7th October 2025**

## Publication

All registered papers will be submitted for publishing by Springer and made available through the [SpringerLink Digital Library](https://www.springer.com/gp/products/digital-}+
libraries). EAI MobiQuitous proceedings are indexed in leading services including Web of Science, Compendex, Scopus, DBLP, EU Digital Library, Google Scholar, and more.

Authors of selected best accepted and presented papers will be invited to submit an extended version to:

*   **Springer Mobile Networks and Applications (MONET) Journal** (IF: 2.3)
*   **EAI Endorsed Transactions on Mobile Communications and Applications** (Fast Track)
*   **EAI Transactions series** (Open Access)
*   **EAI/Springer Innovations in Communications and Computing Book Series** (Indexed in Ei Compendex, Web of Science & Scopus)

callForPapers:
# Call for Papers, Extended Abstracts, Invited Sessions, Mini-Courses

## Introduction

The 26th International Symposium on Mathematical Theory of Networks and Systems (MTNS 2024) is a major symposium in the general area of mathematical systems theory, networks, and control. It is an interdisciplinary event attracting mathematicians, engineers, and researchers from various fields. The symposium is held every two years and is co-sponsored by IFAC.

## Submission Platform and Templates

All submissions to MTNS 2024 are through the [Papercept platform](https://ifac.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl).
The IFAC paper layout and templates can be found at: [https://www.ifac-control.org/events/authors-guide](https://www.ifac-control.org/events/authors-guide)

## Contribution Types and Deadlines

### Full Papers

*   **Deadline for submission:** **12 February, 2024** (Original deadline: 5 February, 2024)
*   **Manuscript length:** Between four (4) and eight (8) pages.
*   **Final version length:** Limited to six (6) pages.
*   **Review process:** Peer review.
*   **Publication:** Accepted papers presented at the MTNS conference will be published in the proceedings of the event using the open-access [IFAC-PapersOnLine series](https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/ifac-paper-on-line).
*   **Requirements:** Must conform to IFAC copyright conditions. Include a maximum of 5 keywords and a maximum of 3 AMS subject classifications.

### Extended Abstracts

*   **Deadline for submission:** **12 February, 2024** (Original deadline: 5 February, 2024)
*   **Length:** Between two (2) and four (4) pages.
*   **Final version length:** Maximum of 4 pages.
*   **Review process:** Simplified review process.
*   **Publication:** Available to conference participants and on the conference website; not formally published. IFAC copyright conditions do not apply.
*   **Requirements:** Include a maximum of 5 keywords and a maximum of 3 AMS subject classifications.

### Invited Sessions

*   **Deadline for submission of proposals:** **15 January, 2024**
*   **Structure:** Consists of 4-6 papers/extended abstracts dealing with a unified theme. Talks are provisionally scheduled for 25 minutes.
*   **Proposal:** A 2-4 page summary statement in PDF format describing the session's relevance, including a brief summary of invited papers.
*   **Review:** Each paper is individually reviewed, and the invited session is evaluated as a whole.
*   **Submission:** Via the Papercept system by the session organiser(s).

### Mini-Courses

*   **Deadline for submission of proposals:** **15 January, 2024**
*   **Structure:** 1 or 2 blocks, each with 4 or 5 slots (25 minutes duration each).
*   **Proposal:** A 2-4 page extended abstract providing the structure of the mini-course.
*   **Submission:** Via the Papercept system by the minicourse organiser(s).

## Key Dates

*   **Proposals for mini-courses and invited sessions:** 15 January 2024
*   **Invited session full papers and extended abstracts submission:** 12 February 2024
*   **Contributed session full papers and extended abstracts submission:** 12 February 2024
*   **Paper, invited session and mini-course decision notification:** 15 May 2024
*   **Final paper upload due:** 12 July 2024
*   **Advance registration opens:** 20 May 2024
*   **Early bird registration closes:** 10 July 2024
*   **Online registration closes:** TBC* (*Banquet tickets cannot be guaranteed after 9th August.)

## Topics of Interest

The symposium covers mathematical systems theory, networks, and control. Mathematical methods involved stem from fields such as ordinary and partial differential equations, real and complex analysis, numerical analysis, probability theory and stochastic analysis, operator theory, linear and commutative algebra, and algebraic and differential geometry. Application areas range from biology, communications, and mathematical finance to problems in electrical, mechanical, aerospace, and chemical engineering, and robotics.

## Publication and Copyright

*   Accepted full papers presented at MTNS will be published in the open-access [IFAC-PapersOnLine series](https://www.sciencedirect.com/journal/ifac-paper-on-line) hosted on ScienceDirect.
*   All publication material must be original and not under review elsewhere.
*   Authors grant exclusive publishing rights to IFAC under a Creative Commons license for the final version.
*   Authors retain copyright and intellectual property rights.
*   IFAC-sponsored conferences adhere to high ethical standards in the review process and publication ethics guidelines.

callForPapers:
# MODELSWARD 2026: Call for Papers

## Scope

The International Conference on Model-Based Software and Systems Engineering (MODELSWARD) provides a platform for participants worldwide to present research results and application experience in using model-based techniques for developing all sorts of systems. MODELSWARD aims to foster the further development and application of model-based techniques for the construction and analysis of software and systems. Papers reporting on original work, advanced prototypes, systems, tools, techniques, and general survey papers indicating future directions are welcome. Accepted papers, presented at the conference by one of the authors, will be published in the MODELSWARD proceedings. The conference is open to full research and (short) work-in-progress papers, with sessions for both oral and poster presentations.

## Conference Areas

Papers may address one or more of the following main topic areas:

### 1. Methodologies, Processes and Platforms
*   Agile Model-Based Development
*   Business Process Management (Modeling, Enactment and Execution)
*   Frameworks for Model-Based Development
*   Multi-level and Multi-view Modeling
*   Model Transformations and Generative Approaches
*   Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Modeling Support

### 2. Software and System Engineering
*   Model-Based System Engineering (MBSE)
*   Model-Based Software Development
*   Model-Based Development of Cyber Physical Systems
*   Model-Based Engineering of Digital Twins
*   Enterprise Architecture Modeling
*   Model-Based Product Lines
*   Model Execution and Simulation
*   Model Quality Assessment
*   Model-Based Testing and Validation
*   Model Management
*   Modeling for AI Applications

### 3. Modeling Languages, Tools and Architectures
*   General-Purpose Modeling Languages and Standards
*   Domain-Specific Modeling
*   Domain-specific LLMs
*   RAG-based LLMs
*   Modeling Language Engineering
*   Modeling Language Syntax and Semantics
*   Reasoning about Models
*   Model Transformation
*   Model-Based Services Infrastructures
*   Modeling Environments

## Keynote Lectures

Keynote speakers are internationally recognized experts. Their names are not yet confirmed.

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a complete paper or an abstract. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

### Submission Types:
*   **Complete Papers:** Submitted as a Regular Paper (completed and validated research) or a Position Paper (work in progress or an arguable opinion).
*   **Abstracts:** Presented at the conference but not published in the proceedings.

### Submission Guidelines:
*   Papers must be in English, carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   Address one or several conference areas or topics, clearly indicating the contribution's nature, applicability, and the problems/domains addressed.
*   **Double-blind paper evaluation method:** Papers must be provided WITHOUT any reference to authors, including personal details, acknowledgments, or other identifying information.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism. Submissions should not substantially overlap with previously published or simultaneously submitted work. Avoid excessive self-citations.
*   All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform [PRIMORIS](http://www.insticc.org/primoris/DirectLink.aspx?idEvent=ncdm2Q47Nqg=&roleName=C7zJAFslO/0=&type=382rcNLtAGk=).
*   Follow the instructions and templates found under Guidelines and Templates.
*   Authors will receive an automatic confirmation e-mail after successful submission.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, under an ISBN reference, on paper and on digital support.
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef; each paper gets a DOI.
*   The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by: **SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index**.
*   A short list of revised and extended versions of presented papers will be invited for publication with Springer in the CCIS Series book (final approval pending).
*   A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.

## Important Dates (all times AOE - Anywhere on Earth)

### Regular Papers
*   **Paper Submission:** October 2, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** December 4, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** December 19, 2025

### Position Papers / Regular Papers
*   **Paper Submission:** November 13, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** December 19, 2025
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** January 13, 2026

### Abstracts Track
*   **Abstract Submission:** December 17, 2025
*   **Authors Notification:** January 14, 2026
*   **Camera Ready and Registration:** January 22, 2026

### Workshops and Special Sessions

### Tutorials, Demos, Panels

### Conference Date

## Venue
